Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Timezone is an international chain of family entertainment centres and amusement arcade centres with a strong foothold in more than 200 locations internationally. We have 15 locations in Singapore and counting.
With our expansion, we are looking for fun and exciting people like you to join our team, so grab this incredible opportunity to be involved and contribute to our expansion!

What do you do?
Motivate and manage team performance to consistently deliver exceptional guest experiences.
Lead and execute plans to achieve venue key performance indicators and targets.
Facilitate training for team members on operational duties.
Develop guest relationships and ensure excellent service.
Utilize basic Visual Merchandising skills to enhance venue presentation.
Oversee inventory levels, manage stock replenishment, and assist with monthly stock-takes.
Manage venue operations, including opening and closing procedures, and daily sales reporting.
Apply conflict management skills to address and resolve feedback effectively.
Facilitate venue events, collaborations, and marketing initiatives.
Ensure staff compliance with company policies and procedures.
Travel across Singapore as required by business needs.

To be successful in this role, you will need to have:
Experience: Minimum 2 years of supervisory experience in a similar entertainment or retail setting.
People Management Skills: Ability to effectively lead and manage a team of 2 to 5 people.
Personal Attributes: Friendly, sales-driven, meticulous, independent, and hands-on with a strong sense of integrity and responsibility.
Flexibility: Willingness to work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays, and adapt to a dynamic work environment

What’s in for you?
Fun work environment
Generous performance based incentives
Growth opportunities to advance your career
Medical/ Dental Coverage
Birthday Leave & Voucher

Other Information:
Working Days: Mon – Sun (2 off days in a week)
Familiar with shift hours (typically 10am to 6pm or 3pm to 11pm)
Available to work on weekends and holidays
You will be given 1 Fri, 1 Sat, and 1 Sun off per month, the other off days will be mostly on off-peak weekdays.

Training will be provided to equip you into our exciting Fun Squad!
If you think you have what it takes to join our Fun Squad and make a positive difference to your career goals, click ‘Apply Now’!

Job Title: Patient Education and Health Activation Executive
Job Description:
Our client is actively searching for a Patient Education and Health Activation Executive to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

You will be part of a dynamic team to champion patient and caregiver education efforts within hospitals and communities. This includes developing and implementing cluster-wide, hospital and community projects and initiatives to enhance patient, caregiver and resident activation. You must work collaboratively with health and social care stakeholders to support nation-wide initiatives such as Ministry of Health’s Healthier SG and build relationship-based care with the wider community of partners, patients, caregivers, volunteers and residents.

The responsibilities of this role are:
Lead in the development, management and execution of community enabling and empowering platforms, projects and initiatives
Design and develop patient education resources, platforms, and programmes to build a community of carers who are equipped with the skills, knowledge and confidence to take ownership of their health
Support clinical leads in research and ground sensing projects relating to health activation, health literacy and patient empowerment
Facilitate focus group discussions and collate insights to identify opportunities for actionable change
Build and facilitate communities of practice made up of health and social care professionals, patients, caregivers and volunteers
Co-lead in the conceptualisation and execution of hospital and community events and regular community dialogue sessions with patients, caregivers, residents and partners
Drive publicity campaigns to raise awareness of department's key initiatives
Manage department resources and implement programmes, projects and events within set budgets, funding mechanisms and timeline
Provide secretariat support at key stakeholders' meetings
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
Strong passion for population health
Degree in Social Sciences/Behavioral Science/Psychology/Social Anthropology or a related field
At least 2 years of corporate experience, preferably in the healthcare and/or social care sectors
A creative thinker with excellent written and verbal communications skills
Excellent team leader and player with a positive can-do attitude
Ability to multi-task, resourceful and highly resilient
Work effectively under tight deadlines and manage projects independently
Excellent knowledge of social media platforms and website management
Experience in event management and vendor management
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Part Time Counsellor / Up to $40 / hour / Yishun
Job Description:
Job Description
1. Counselling Work: Provide individual and group counselling to students being referred including:
· Conducting face-to-face counselling.
· Collaborating with teachers, Case Management Team and School Leaders regarding students being counseled.
· Working with families of students being counseled.
· Conducting home visits with other school personnel) where necessary.
· Referring students and families to community resources for specialized assistance where necessary.
· Providing regular updates/feedback (frequency of updates to be determined by school) to school administration/management and teachers
· concerned on the work done/cases with the students counseled.
· Providing support such as conducting relevant group work/workshops/activities for students and parents with educational needs
· Providing consultation to school administration and teachers on non referral cases and other counselling related matters.
2. Counselling-related Activities: Expansion of duties include:
· Documentation of cases and all counselling work done.
· End-of-Year Summary Report would be placed in Student’s Confidential File.
· All case notes are to be kept in school.
· Recording of cases and sharing with relevant teachers.
· Conduct training related to social and emotional development of students for teachers and parents.
· Reach out to students and parents to build rapport and create understanding of counselling services (eg talks in class etc).
· Monthly summary report of cases to be submitted to the Reporting Officer and School Leaders.

Requirements
· A Master’s Degree in counselling with relevant professional counselling training.
· High level of professionalism and a strong work ethic.
· Have experience in working with youths and their families in counselling.
· Strong assessment skills with the ability to advocate for the best interest of the child.
· A team-player who has strong communication and interpersonal skills and can adapt to different working styles to achieve common goals. Is organized, meticulous and able to manage complexity

Working hours
· Mondays to Fridays: 7.30am to 2.30pm inclusive of 1/2hr lunch break
· Service not required on Saturdays, Sundays and gazetted public holidays

Working locations
· (School environment)

Additional info:
· Contract Period: From 1 January 2025 to 31 December 2025
· With option to extend (Discretion)
· This is an outsource role

Job Description:
Internal Code: AXI25002

Headquartered in Singapore, Actxa Pte Ltd is a deep tech company founded in 2015 that leverages artificial intelligence to create next generation preventive healthcare solutions.

We create evidence-based, personalised health insights in the domains of physical activities, sleep quality, body composition, stress and recovery, heart health and blood glucose evaluation and monitoring.

To improve population health, Actxa establishes worldwide partnerships and research collaborations to develop critical preventive health models to help people avert chronic diseases such as diabetes and hypertension.
Conducting market research and analysis to identify potential investors, merger or acquisition targets, and industry trends.

Participating in negotiations with investors, target companies, and other stakeholders.
Supporting post-merger integration activities, such as developing integration plans and assisting with the execution of integration initiatives.

What are we looking for?
A strong academic background in business, finance, or a related field.
Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to gather and interpret complex data.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with colleagues and stakeholders.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience or knowledge of fundraising, merger and acquisition, or corporate finance would be an advantage.
High attention to detail and the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Fun and open culture

Job Title: Junior / Senior R&D Engineer (Application & System Development)
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Work closely with IC design & product development teams to develop a deep understanding of new products’ characteristics and features.
Architect, design, and implement new sensing features and algorithms that align with products, solutions, or customer requirements. Additionally, develop use models and application demonstrations for sales and marketing promotion.
Create application notes, white papers, and technical documents to provide information and support to customers.
Develop evaluation kits and demonstration kits for new sensing products, and conduct testing to evaluate results. Create and maintain documentation.
Conduct application training for internal teams on new products.
Provide feedback to the design & development teams by communicating customer needs, issues, and opportunities that can be used in new product development and design.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in electrical, electronics, or related engineering.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in R&D/Application/Embedded System/Product Development environment.
Proficiency in common programming languages (C, C#, Python, etc.) and development platforms (Raspberry Pi, Arduino, Wireless-SoC, etc.).
Experience with tools such as IDEs, in-circuit emulators, and oscilloscopes.
Strong technical knowledge of optoelectronics devices and sensor applications and experience in optical-related test and characterization, is desirable.
Experience with machine learning frameworks is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with customer support and training.
Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment.

Assistant Cook Job description

The assistant cook will prepare meals and follow establishment recipes. Duties include preparing ingredients, adhering to the restaurant menu, and following food health and safety procedures. Cook, clean, assist other cooks and staff and deliver food in a fast-paced environment. Work may include operating a grill, oven, or fryer. That prata master need to play as multitasking role, candidate must be ready for flour mixing as well as making prata

• Setting up, cleaning, and organizing work stations

• Making Varieties of RotiPrata (egg prata, Bananprata, coin prata,etc.,)

• Making Chappathi and Chappathi flour mixing
• preparation of south indian& north indian curies

• Dressing order for presentation
• Ensuring each guest order has the correct food and sides
• Delivering food order to wait staff in a timely manner

• Reordering stock and food supplies
• Monitoring other cooks and team members
• Assisting other cooks in preparing food or helping other team members when needed

Requirements and Qualifications

• Ready to work any shift
• Able to work in a fast-paced environment
• Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
• Physical endurance to stand for an entire shift
• Self-motivated and self-directed

• Previous experience as a busboy, cook, or relevant work experience

• Able to work early mornings, nights, and weekends
• Must pass a background check

Job Description:
As an Investment Operations Executive, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operations in the investment portfolios and funds managed by the Company. You will be responsible for a wide range of tasks, including trade placement and/or execution, cash management, and performance reporting.

Key Responsibilities:
• Trade Placement/Execution:
o Place and/or execute trades in equities and/or fixed income instruments and ensuring accuracy and timely execution.
o Reconcile trade confirmations and statements.
o Monitor corporate actions, such as dividends, mergers, and spin-offs.

• Cash Management:
o Manage fund cash balances and ensure sufficient liquidity.
o Monitor cash flows and reconcile bank statements.
o Process fund expenses and payments.

• Performance Reporting:
o Prepare and analyze fund performance reports.
o Calculate returns, risk metrics, and other key performance indicators.
o Respond to client inquiries regarding fund performance.

• Data Management:
o Maintain accurate and up-to-date investment data.
o Ensure data integrity and consistency across different systems.
o Assist in the implementation of new systems and processes.

• Regulatory Compliance:
o Adhere to regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
o Assist in the preparation of regulatory filings.
o Monitor changes in regulations and ensure compliance.

Qualifications and Skills:
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
• 1-3 years of experience in investment operations or a similar role.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial analysis tools.
• Attention to detail and accuracy.
• Excellent organizational and time management skills.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Desired Skills:
• Experience with investment accounting systems (e.g., Advent, Bloomberg AIM).
• Knowledge of Singapore's regulatory environment.

Job Description:
OVERVIEW
The Director, Digital is responsible for close collaboration and engagement with departments in the Company such as Finance, Operations, HR, and Marketing/Sales functions to create and execute Digital Strategy and plan that will bridge Digital assets and existing practices to the evolving needs of the Organisation. Working with local and remote teams, the Director, Digital, will ensure seamless integration of all business applications within this growing Organization. He/She reports to the CEO based in Singapore and functionally to the Digital & Technology Group team. The Director, Digital acts as a true business consultant to the leaders in the Company with technological dimension to strategic priorities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Implement, manage, upgrade or redesign Digital projects:
Manage the ALM (Application Life cycle Management) of all the local software according to the roadmap of the editors and the guidelines of the Babilou Family Teams (Finance, Digital, Sales, HR, etc)
Lead, coordinate and monitor operational project tool as required for the planning, development, testing, and implementation phases according to departmental and IT guidelines
Work with local and group teams (support functions and operations) to deliver change management to ensure new processes/technology are deployed effectively
Train end-users to accurately and consistently use systems
Manage and complete projects in a timely manner within budget controls and defined quality standards
Provide communications regarding projects status to all appropriate parties throughout the lifecycle of the project, including communication with group headquarter (overseas)
Ensure the effective integration of existing programs and strategies with newly acquired assets/schools so that long- and short-term business goals are attained, where applicable

2. Work on Finance system management:
Map and maintain the accounting system to the parent system that includes general ledger, accounts receivable, accounts payable, treasury, financial reporting and budgeting;
Coordinate the build (in case of new acquisition of entities / countries) and the maintenance of interfaces between the Microsoft Dynamics AX365 accounting software and the payroll system, banks, the local authorities (GST, etc)
Coordination of local team for the Group Finance EPM implementation

3. Manage the CRM system/Operational tools:
Management of the current CRM for the business
Lead the implementation and functionalities of the CRM including the interconnection with the other software of the IT Landscape
Leads acquisition strategy implementation and tracking through the system
Improve the CRM tool including reporting, BI tools, KPI’s and interface with other Digital softwares
Coordination of local team for the implementation of new Analytics/Performance reporting tool/processes to help drive business decisions
Coordination with the integrators of the local solutions regarding the evolutions required for the performance analysis needs in the Organisation

4. Manage and is overall responsible for the Digital assets and performance in the Company including commodities, network, cyber security, PCs, Contract management with local providers according to guidelines provided by the Babilou Family team

5. Responsible for designing the internal processes around our tools and workflow


JOB REQUIREMENTS
At least 15 years of project management experience in an application/software development environment, preferably with experience driving solutions on Enterprise platforms (e.g., ERP systems, Sales/Service tools, HR systems)
Experience in end-to-end IT project management and the system development lifecycle, leading and supporting cross-functional and IT transformation initiatives and facilitating discussions with executives
Experience using Finance systems and with Finance business processes (Accruals, Revenue Recognition, etc.)
Working knowledge of Dynamics AX is appreciated or deep experience in a comparable CRM/ERP system
Proficient with project management principles (e.g. resource allocation, cost estimation, risk analysis)
Demonstrated practical experience, flexibility, and adaptability with multiple project management approaches (waterfall, agile)
Experience working with geographically distributed teams with an ability to drive team collaboration, communication, and effectiveness
Strong reporting and communication skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills able to effectively articulate complex concepts and ideas to broad audiences
Experience establishing new processes and successfully managing change
Results oriented, proactive, organised
Proven track record of effective decision-making
Experience coaching/mentoring others
Strong facilitation, negotiation and influencing skills can effectively drive discussions and decisions toward desired results, able to get things done without formal authority
Experience effectively partnering with vendors and consultants
Experience effectively working with globally distributed teams

Job Description:
Carry out activities of the front-of-house work stations and serving counter area. Mise en place, cleans utensils & work areas and performs other day-to-day operations.

Each day brings its own unique experiences, you will:
Clean/ sanitise work stations at the start and end of work shift
Enter orders and process payments via the point of sale
Restock bottled and canned beverages, as well as snack items when they are almost and empty
Replenish and arrange F&B Items, packaging, cutlery to assigned shelves/ stations
Monitor temperature of warmer cart cabinets & beverage chillers and report any maintenance and repairs
Ensure that utensils and serving ware are cleaned/ sanitised and ready for use & serve food
Assist with basic food preparation and packaging
Plate small dishes such as snacks, appetizers and/or desserts
Distribution of pre-ordered meals
Greet, Smile and say Thank You in a quick and friendly manner
Perform additional skill-development and ad-hoc tasks assigned by the Canteen Manager
We are looking for people with:
Previous experiences in Catering/Quick Service/Cafeteria settings, would assist in delivering exceptional & efficient services
Understanding basic food allergens is essential for ensuring a safe dining experience
Your awareness in food and beverage operations contributes to a secure environment for everyone
We value friendly, engaging interactions that enhance our colleagues & customers’ experiences
We appreciate open and honest communication, built on integrity
Your meticulous nature will help us maintain high standards
Thriving in a diverse environment, you’ll contribute to our inclusive workplace

If you’re ready to make a positive impact and grow with us, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Description:
Toby's Estate originated in 1997 in Woolloomooloo, driven by a simple mission: to roast exceptional coffee and foster a family-like environment.
Fast forward 26 years, our spirited team stands united—a cheerful band of unconventional individuals driven by a shared passion for achieving remarkable feat. We remain at the forefront, continuously challenging the boundaries of premium specialty coffee. And now, Toby's Estate has made its mark in Singapore, spreading our commitment to excellence across new horizons.
About the role?
Work alongside our FOH and barista team to ensure that every cup of coffee that leaves our hands is at the same high-quality standard.
Provide an excellent coffee experience to our Toby's customers.
Lead by example and motivate those around you, service, and a spirit of genuine hospitality.
· Opportunity for growth and development in the specialty coffee industry
This is a part-time role working at least 15 hours across the week including 1 weekend.
Who are we looking for?
A genuine love for coffee and the hospitality industry and is eager to share their knowledge and experience.
The ability to build strong relationships with both coworkers and our customers.
· Demonstrated ability to remain composed and efficient while working under pressure.
What’s on offer?
· A fun and creative working environment, working as part of an engaged and enthusiastic team.
· Development of coffee knowledge, technique and understanding
· As much coffee as you can drink and free staff meal!

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements

Overall Job Purpose
Lead or assist a team in the development and building of CMMS databases for new or existing projects, provide support to the team(s) to ensure contractual/specification functionality and business objectives are achieved.Take part in other activities assigned or designated by the manager relating to the current role.
Core Responsibilities
• Execution of the delivery for the CMMS Database build as per planned schedule and milestones.
• Lead and oversee work execution of a CMMS database build or data mining/gathering activity for use with a CMMS.
Vetting on the quality of final data to be included in the CMMS build as per project specification.
• Coordination of data information requirement with EPCI group, project managers and client. Serves as the main point of contact on CMMS database project and/or remediation work.
• Identifying maintainable equipment/items to be marked for the CMMS from various sources.
• Meet with project groups in relation to data acquisition and delivery to the build team.
• Provide monthly reports on the status of assigned CMMS database build project.
• Guides and ensures database build team members follow project specification standards.
• Ensure CMMS database handover acceptance as per agreed specifications and functionality with client.
• Implementation of CMMS database remediation projects as per agreed work scope.
• Support and assist in implementation of change requests in the CMMS for the company’s internal operating assets when requested.
• To manage and update project schedules and progress diligently.
• To give feedback and suggest improvements to current CMMS database build or data mining/gathering processes.
• Ensure constant communication flow to the Information Management team and individuals involved in the project.
Educational Qualification:
• Preferable with a 4-year Bachelor Diploma in Marine or Mechanical or Electrical engineering.
Relevant Work Experience (Mandatory):
• At least 1.5 years working on CMMS plant maintenance database or from a marine vessel or onshore plant maintenance related background.
• Exposure to onshore production plant or Marine or Oil and Gas industry.
• User and operating knowledge to at least one Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS). E.g., SAP-PM, Maximo, NSE, AMOS, TM Master, Star Systems, etc.
• Practical exposure to data acquisition and manipulation to facilitate a secure, complete, and accurate data gathering and processing.
• Identifying tags, boundary mark ups, location and its boundaries from P&ID’s and other source materials. ***
• Able to identify maintainable equipment from tags and P&ID’s. ***

Job Description:
Business Development:
1.⁠ ⁠Market Research: Identify new business opportunities, analyze market trends, and gather competitive intelligence to inform strategic decisions.
2.⁠ ⁠Partnership Development: Build and maintain relationships with partners, suppliers, and stakeholders to drive revenue growth and expand the business network.
3.⁠ ⁠Opportunity Identification: Develop and implement strategies to identify, pursue, and secure new business opportunities, including sales leads and partnerships.
4.⁠ ⁠Proposal Writing: Craft compelling proposals and presentations to win new business, including conducting cost-benefit analyses and financial modeling.
5.⁠ ⁠Project Management: Oversee the implementation of new business projects, ensuring timely delivery, budget adherence, and stakeholder satisfaction.
6.⁠ ⁠Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with internal teams, including sales, marketing, and product development, to ensure alignment and effective communication.
7.⁠ ⁠Performance Analysis: Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business development success and inform future strategies.
Finance Controller:
1.⁠ ⁠Financial Planning and Analysis: Develop and maintain financial models, forecasts, and budgets to inform strategic decision-making.
2.⁠ ⁠Financial Reporting: Prepare and present accurate, timely, and comprehensive financial reports to management, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.
3.⁠ ⁠Risk Management: Identify, assess, and mitigate financial risks, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and internal controls.
4.⁠ ⁠Internal Controls: Establish, maintain, and ensure adherence to financial policies, procedures, and internal controls, including SOX compliance.
5.⁠ ⁠Accounting Operations: Oversee and ensure the efficient operation of the accounting function, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and treasury management.
6.⁠ ⁠Tax Compliance: Manage tax planning, compliance, and filing obligations, including ensuring accurate and timely tax returns.
7.⁠ ⁠Audit and Compliance: Coordinate and facilitate external audits, ensuring compliance with financial regulations and standards.

Job Description:
The key roles and responsibilities are as follows:
Create Client Strategy – Develops effective strategies to drive profitable and sustainable growth. Maintain effective communication with country account team.
Execute Client Strategy – Responsible for implementing the strategic account strategy to maximize new service opportunities while acting as the client trusted advisor.
Achieve set portfolio/ account targets – including revenue, contracts signed, customer satisfaction and profitability. Responsible for to maximize operational excellence, drive profitable growth and minimize risk for FB.
Navigate Political Environment – Identifies, understands, and leverages the political dynamics in the client organization and within company to effectively achieve your goals. Develop a network of appropriate executive relationships.
Engage Senior Executives Through Thought Leadership – Establishes position of business advisor as well as creating potential growth opportunities with client executives by demonstrating thought leadership and strategic thinking.
Business Value Communication – Responsible for communicating and leveraging the value delivered to expand the client relationship and increase the business growth opportunities.
Represent the One Face of FB – Creates opportunities for selling unique, value-added solutions through the effective positioning of the full spectrum of the FUJIFILM portfolio. Architect & present bid and negotiate terms to gain contract.
Lead Virtual Bid team(s) – Leads, motivates, and inspires virtual teams to successfully execute client strategies and tactics to maximize sales effectiveness and increase win rates. Follow established pursuit process and gain defined approvals.
Innovation - Seeks opportunities for different and innovative approaches to addressing problems and opportunities.
Interpersonal Skills - Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with people; successfully addresses conflicts and problems involving people.
To succeed in this role, the candidate should possess the following qualifications, skills and experience:
Post Graduate Degree preferably in Management with more than 8 years working in IT consulting preferred, experience in Print Industry would be a plus, with significant experience in client engagement activities.
Strong presentation skills with effective spoken and written communication
Demonstrated the ability to develop value-based relationships within clients and leveraging them into multi-million dollar account relationships.
Led many business development cycles by using service-based solutions, demonstrating consultative selling and demonstrating closing skills.
Established a track record of achieving financial targets.
Superior engagement skill in managing lifecycle of complex sale and multiple client engagement.
Demonstrated ability to motivate and manage team, as well as mentor / coach individuals in the team.
Co-develop relationship expectations with key client executives.
Financial skills to construct business case based on decision making criteria.
In-depth industry knowledge in print and related industry
Strong knowledge of “Managed Print Services” and “Transaction Print Cycle” are desired skills.
Negotiation and commercial acumen
Use of Salesforce.com

Candidates with a portable book of business will receive priority consideration. Team moves are also welcomed, providing an excellent opportunity for existing groups of lawyers to join our corporation and leverage their collective expertise.

Job Description:
About The Role
Are you passionate about turning ideas into memorable events? Join us at OOm as our new Event Coordinator! In this full-time, on-site role, you'll be responsible for organising and managing events for both OOm Agency and OOm Institute. You will handle everything from the initial planning stages through to execution and wrap-up, ensuring each event is a success.

We are looking for someone with a knack for organisation and a keen eye for detail. If you can juggle multiple tasks efficiently and stay on top of every detail, this is the role for you. Your role will be crucial in crafting seamless and impactful events, making sure everything runs smoothly and meets our high standards. If you are ready to take on a dynamic role and contribute to exciting events, we would love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities

Event Coordination
- Facilitate seamless operation of digital and in-person events.
- Coordinate with internal teams, vendors, contractors, partners, and sponsors to ensure timely execution and smooth operations.

Event Setup
- Lead the setup and teardown of events, overseeing on-site operations throughout the event duration.

Event Run-Down
- Develop event timelines and oversee adherence to schedule.

Post-Event Evaluation
- Plan and conduct surveys to gather attendee feedback.
- Evaluate feedback and conduct post-event reviews to identify areas for improvement and implement process enhancements.

Event Publicity & Marketing Materials
- Collaborate with the marketing team and designers to prepare effective marketing and publicity materials.
- Coordinate with social media content creators, photographers, and videographers to produce post-event marketing materials.

Logistics
- Plan and manage all logistical aspects, including transportation, accommodations, and guest services.
- Prepare and manage documents for licence applications and other regulatory requirements.

Vendors & Suppliers
- Oversee the procurement of event-related materials and equipment.
- Review vendors' and suppliers’ deliverables to ensure quality standards and manage production timelines.

Budgeting
- Manage the operations budget, including forecasting, purchasing, and tracking expenses.

Administrative
- Ensure proper organisation of site documentation and filing systems.
- Handle event invoicing and payment processing.
- Undertake any ad-hoc tasks as and when assigned.

Requirements

1) Experience in Event Planning and Management: Proven track record in organising and managing events.
2) Strong Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication with the ability to collaborate effectively.
3) Organisational and Project Management Skills: Effective in managing multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.
4) Attention to Detail and Problem-Solving: Sharp attention to detail and quick problem-solving skills.
5) Ability to Work Under Pressure: Capable of staying composed and meeting deadlines in high-pressure situations.
6) Flexibility and Adaptability: Able to adjust to changing requirements and unforeseen challenges.
7) Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite: Competent in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
6) Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign (Bonus): Familiarity with these tools is an advantage.

Job Description:
Vista Musical Instruments is an innovative, global collective of music-related brands dedicated to building meaningful products and experiences for the music community. Brands include MONO, Harmony, Teisco, Heritage Guitars, Swee Lee, Dawsons, and Manny’s. Vista Musical Instruments is headquartered in Singapore, with operations in the USA, UK, and APAC, and is a part of Caldecott Music Group.
Established in 1946 and headquartered in Singapore, Swee Lee is South East Asia's leading omni-channel musical instrument and lifestyle retailer and distributor. Committed to community and creativity, the brand's mission is to be the region's trusted house of music and expression. Swee Lee is known for curating immersive experiences at their cafes and Local store concepts, and matching customers with the products and services they need throughout their musical journey. With a legacy rooted in thoughtfulness, resourcefulness, and enthusiasm, Swee Lee embodies a passion for music that resonates across the region. Swee Lee is a part of Vista Musical Instruments and has locations in 5+ countries across South East Asia.
We are looking for an experienced digital piano technician to join our regional team. The role is based in Singapore and will be focused on delivering the best possible customer service for the musical instrument repair industry. We want somebody who is self-driven, passionate, and very organized. Someone who matches our spirit and desire and to keep challenging ourselves to push to be the best in the industry.
As a Freelance Digital Piano Technician, you will be responsible for diagnosing, repairing, and maintaining digital pianos for our clients. This role requires a deep understanding of digital piano technology, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to provide exceptional customer service.
The incumbent will be responsible for the following:
● Diagnose and troubleshoot issues with digital pianos, including electrical, mechanical, and software-related problems.
● Perform repairs and maintenance on various models of digital pianos.
● Conduct regular inspections and tune-ups to ensure optimal performance.
● Provide detailed reports on the condition and necessary repairs for each instrument.
● Offer expert advice and guidance to clients regarding the care and maintenance of their digital pianos.
● Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in digital piano technology and repair techniques.
● Maintain a clean and organized workspace, ensuring all tools and equipment are in good working condition.
● Communicate effectively with clients and supporting teammates to schedule appointments and provide updates on repair progress.
Qualifications:
● Proven experience as a digital piano technician or similar role.
● Strong knowledge of digital piano technology, including hardware, software, and electronics.
● Proficient in using diagnostic tools and repair equipment.
● Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
● Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
● Strong communication and customer service skills.
● Valid driver's license and reliable transportation (on-site work is required).
Preferred Qualifications:
● Certification or formal training in digital piano repair or a related field.
● Experience working with a variety of digital piano brands and models.
● Familiarity with MIDI technology and software.
Compensation:
● Competitive hourly rate or per-job payment, based on experience and scope of work.
● Flexible work schedule with the opportunity to work remotely or on-site as needed.

Roles & Responsibilities

Coordinate day-to-day project and operational activities

Acquire and allocate resources to support operations.

Maintain relationships with clients.

Manage customers and suppliers relationships

Manage information exchange between clients and business.

Manage issues arising from servicing client accounts.

Optimise utilisation of resources.

Oversee implementation of workflow improvements to improve efficiency

Plan, direct and evaluate the operations of establishments engaged in wholesale sales

Manage and support distribution channels in fulfilling sales objectives and achieving the best market coverage

Preparation of reports including monthly performance, quarterly and yearly business reviews

Establish new sourcing networks and strengthen existing supplier relationships for goods desirable to our customers

Maintain strong business relationships with suppliers and vendors

Ensure compliance with BCA , MOM authorities' regulations, occupational health and safety regulations

Manage shipping, BCA, import matters relating to wholesale of construction materials

Prepare documents for shipment, landing permit , declare shipment import

Prepare BCA declaration and manage quota calculation

Manage staff and assign duties, plan budgets and authorize expenditures, resolve customer complaints

Reports directly to General Manager

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum O Level & above (Diploma preference) in any related discipline

Experience in B2B sales, project coordination and operational activities

Knowledge in Building and Construction materials is an advantage

Job Title: Senior Associate / Manager, Client Account Specialist
Job Description:
About the company

CGS International Securities Pte. Ltd. (CGS International) is an award-winning and market leading integrated financial services provider, ranked among the top securities houses in Asia.

CGS International taps on our wealth of global and ASEAN insights to offer equities trading, leveraged products, wealth management, investment banking, equities research, Shariah-compliant financing, fixed income, currency and commodities, structured products and prime brokerage services in over 15 countries and regions.
Along with its parent organisation China Galaxy Securities, a leading securities house in China, CGS International is trusted by more than 15 million customers globally.

We are seeking a committed individual to join the equities operational team to support the daily reconciliation process and operational control reporting. The candidate needs to be attentive to details with data integrity mindset who thrives off learning new skills and challenging yourself in operational efficiency area.

Job Responsibilities
Make proactive outbound calls to ensure all prospects and clients are contacted, primarily by phone, using Salesforce CRM to manage your daily tasks.
Reconnect with dormant or inactive clients through outbound calls to boost engagement and sales.
Take part in client acquisition activities like in-person events, seminars, and webinars to grow your client base.
Develop and execute a contact strategy aimed at driving optimal client activation.
Have a solid understanding of the company’s products, services, and competitors to confidently engage with clients.
Be familiar with the onboarding process and deposit/withdrawal procedures to provide clients with a smooth experience.
Act as the first point of contact, educating and guiding clients, while answering any questions about the platform and products.
Perform upselling and cross-selling where appropriate.
Follow all company policies, procedures, and industry regulations.
Success in this role will be measured by the number and quality of client interactions, as well as client activation rates, including account funding and trading activities.

Job Requirement
Proficiency in English & Mandarin to converse with external clients
Positive attitude
Proactive team player who is able to work independently
Pays attention to detail and well-organized
Able to work well under pressure and goal-oriented
Basic knowledge in trading products including stocks, ETFs, Regular Savings Plans etc, and a brief understanding of the firm’s offerings
Good communicator, must be able to actively engage client in two-way communications especially in-person or over the phone
CMFAS certified
1-2 years’ experience in a client facing role, over the phone sales will be a benefit.
Degree/Diploma in any discipline, preferably Business/Finance-related
Fresh Graduates are welcomed.

Job Description:
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Live Streaming & Event Partnerships Coordinator to join our dynamic team. This role combines business development and event planning for live streaming and events. The ideal candidate will need to be responsible for identifying potential clients, designing exclusive business packages, and managing partnerships with vendors and merchants. Occasional overseas travel will be required to manage events and build relationships internationally.

Key Responsibilities:
Client Acquisition:
Identify and approach potential clients, including businesses, vendors, and merchants, for live streaming and roadshow events.
Build and maintain strong relationships with merchants and clients to secure partnerships for both local and international events.
Conduct market research to identify new opportunities for live streaming services and roadshows, both domestically and overseas.

Business Package Development:
Collaborate with internal teams to develop tailored and exclusive business packages for clients.
Create promotional materials and proposals that showcase the value of live streaming and event services.
Negotiate contract terms with merchants and clients, ensuring mutually beneficial partnerships.

Event Planning & Coordination:
Assist in the planning and execution of live streaming and roadshow events, ensuring seamless coordination between vendors, merchants, and production teams.
Ensure all event details are executed in a timely and efficient manner, including managing international logistics and cross-border event coordination.
Overseas Travel & Event Support:
Travel overseas to coordinate live streaming events and roadshows as required.
Build relationships with international vendors and clients, expanding the company’s global reach.
Ensure all international events run smoothly, adapting to local requirements and regulations.
Reporting & Analysis:
Track event performance metrics and prepare post-event reports for clients and internal teams.
Collect feedback from clients and partners to continuously improve the quality of services.
Identify areas for growth and propose new strategies to enhance client acquisition and retention.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, event management, or a related field.
Experience in client acquisition, sales, or business development.
Proficiency in both Mandarin and English to accommodate our potential clients.
Knowledge of live-streaming platforms for live events.
Strong organizational and communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Familiarity with event planning and vendor coordination is a plus.

column12: Proprietary Futures Trader – Agricultural (Singapore, HK or China)
column13:
Location: Singapore
Proprietary Futures Trader – Agricultural
AP Capital is seeking an experienced Proprietary Futures Arbitrage Trader to join our team ideally in Singapore, HK or China. As a Futures Trader specializing in the agricultural sector, you will play a pivotal role in generating revenue.
You will lead and manage:
Trading Strategies: Utilize your expertise in the agricultural products industry to create and implement commodity arbitrage trading strategies and execution. (China vs Global arb)
Agricultural Futures Arbitrage: Take ownership of arbitrage trading for agricultural product futures and commodity futures, encompassing both offshore and onshore products. (products such as Grains, Veg Oils, Soy etc)
Holdings Analysis and Reporting: Organize and consolidate business segment holdings. Monitor brokerage bank funds and monthly positions, promptly communicating updates to the trading supervisor.
Industry Research and Reporting: Collect, organize, and analyze industry data. Monitor industry trends, conduct thorough research within your designated sector, and prepare insightful research reports.
Investment Opportunity Identification: Demonstrate a keen eye for recognizing valuable investment opportunities within the market.
Qualifications:
Relevant Experience: Possess a minimum of 3-5 years of hands-on experience within the futures or securities finance industry with Futures or commodities arbitrage and a solid PnL Trackrecord.
Market Insight: Showcase your perceptive market insights, combined with exceptional organizational, planning and logical analysis skills. Effective communication, coordination, and execution abilities are essential.
Initiative and Team Spirit: Demonstrate a strong sense of initiative, responsibility, and execution capability. Possess excellent communication and problem-solving skills, coupled with a collaborative team spirit.
Adaptability: Thrive in diverse work environments and effectively manage work pressure.
Educational Background: Hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in economics, finance, mathematics, statistics, engineering or related field.
If you are ready to contribute your expertise to a thriving trading environment, where your skills will be valued and your potential will be nurtured, AP Capital invites you to be part of our team.
Join us in shaping the future of agricultural commodities trading.

Job Description:
Black & White is expanding and looking for a Mechanical Technical Director for our Singapore office.

We are looking for confident, self-motivated individuals to integrate into our established teams.

We are looking for candidates with mission critical and commercial experience in all sectors to work on major international projects.

You will receive the opportunity to work in a positive environment in an ambitious and expanding organisation that offers career progression of our international offices around the world.

Candidates should be currently based in the SG and willing to work in Singapore and across Asia on Asia Pacific and Global projects.

Candidates should have a relevant degree in Mechanical Building Services engineering (or equivalent qualification), CEng (or equivalent) of an appropriate professional body, and experience in leading successful and dynamic teams.

This role is for a technically focused professional with significant experience and a passion for being involved in the detail, to lead, manage and develop the mechanical services teams and service offer to ensure that we remain at the leading edge of the sectors we operate in.

With overall accountability for the performance of their team as part of the wider global office management team; responsibilities will include –
- Acting as the lead engineer and/or Project Director, liaising with the client and external multi-discipline design teams (separately appointed or as sub-consultants as part of B&W Lead Design Consultant appointments) and managing our internal teams as required for the successful delivery of projects
- Compiling specifications, drawings and relevant contract documents and maintaining the required technical quality of work, ensuring that designs comply with the relevant Codes, Standards, Regulations and Procedures
- The development and implementation of plans for the longer-term benefit to the office
- Working very closely with our in-house design teams at an in-depth technical level to ensure that concepts, schemes and detailed design development is closely aligned with the project and client requirements whilst capturing opportunities for technical advancement and value driven solutions.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS (Professional & Technical Expertise)
BSc/BEng in appropriate engineering discipline or have sufficient equivalent experience
MCIBSE/MIEE or HNC/HND +appropriate experience or equivalent
Chartered Engineer status desirable
Proven experience in managing a multi-disciplinary team with the successful delivery of the design for critical project
Experience in project management and MEP engineering track record with some experience of data centres or other critical engineering facilities.
Minimum of 10 years broad range of building types and design experience with preferably at least 3 years of data centre design experience
Enthusiastic, driven, and dynamic self-starter with career progression aspirations
Appreciation & working knowledge of contract & business law
Peripheral experience in architecture, structures, civils, security and permitting
Sound understanding of template design with localisation requirements
Ability to forge strong client, contractor and supplier relationships and maintain the same
Ability to mentor and develop the team to achieve project and business goals
Ability to contribute to the growth of the business via business development
Ability to work autonomously, as part of a wider team, and leading a team with strong leadership skills
Ability to embrace an intensively collaborative design environment working for and reporting daily to an expert client
Ability to proactively step outside the role of conventional design regiment and stages to achieve the client’s deliverables
Proficient in use of Microsoft projects or other programme software
Ability to use IT based calculation and spreadsheet software
Flexible and willing to travel to service international projects and customers
Commercial and financial awareness and management of projects and fees
Sound knowledge & working application of key Health and Safety issues and legislation
Able to chair and facilitate meetings at all levels
Possess exceptional clear communication skills and command of spoken/written English
Have an appreciation of different cultures/races and embrace the same
Understand and maintain the long-term goals of the business
Understand the company QA process, maintain and contribute to the same
Ability to solve complex issues effectively

Job Title: Software Developer - Java, Spring boot, Microservices
Job Description:
Responsibilities
Provide the overall API/Micro Services design, solution and integration components of MircoServices platform aligned with Data Product Manager and Enterprise Architect.
Manage Product/Project lifecycle, from requirement, design, technical construction, testing, acceptance, training, documentation and implementation, in accordance with Project Management Process and Methodology best practices. This includes:
Perform business requirement analysis and do technical assessment to identify functional & non-functional requirements.
Participate in pre-project activities such as estimation of project efforts, project budgeting, preparation of high-level project plan with project timeline and resource requirements and staffing and organization of project team.
To work with the Product Manager to Plan, coordinate and communicate project plan, timeline and activities to the project team.
Manage and coordinate project deliverables, ensuring their quality and configuration management.
Maintain project issue register to keep close match of the project issues till their resolution.
Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
Manage performance of the project team, guide the project team in resolving issues, and resolve conflicts within the project team.
Monitor and track progress of projects and stay on top of the projects to ensure smooth execution.
Provide periodic update on project progress to project sponsors and escalate project issues not resolvable at project team level to PSC team.
Lead a team of developers on the build of API/Micro Services required by Industry and related projects. This includes:
Provide leadership in the implementation of API/Micro Services using Spring Boot, Dockers, Kubernetes, CI/CD and other relevant tools.
Define, configure and maintain API definitions to secure control and manage APIs. Maintain Swagger definition required to publish APIs.
Build and test APIs for new and existing backend services to help facilitate development team migrations.
Responsible for the documentation & maintenance of micro services catalogue for internal & external usage. Documentation will include Detail Design Document, API Technical Specifications & other necessary information to support the platform or assigned projects.
Responsible for the maintenance of MircoServices platform ensuring platform meets SLA and activities which includes:
Enhancement of tools, solutions and microservices associated with deployment and our operations platform.
Actively troubleshoot any issues that arise during testing and production, catching and solving issues before launch.
Support all planned maintenance activities, BAU activities for API/Micro Services including any emergency maintenance.
Maintain awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and appropriate steps to mitigate the risks; and
Highlight any potential concerns/risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.
Skills Requirement
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Programming & Systems Analysis/Science (Computer Studies).
5-7 years of overall experience in professional IT/software engineering.
5 years of experience as Technical Lead and have lead min 3-4 projects from scratch owning solution, design & implementation using API/Micro Services.
4 years of hands-on experience with various API technologies, Spring Boot, Spring Integration, Java, Kubernetes & Dockers.
3-4 years of experience leading development team and delivery management experience, with proven track records in managing and steering projects towards smooth execution and on time delivery.
2-3-years of experience implementing applications & services using Spring Framework, Spring Boot & other Java related technologies with CI/CD tool like Jenkins/Bamboo, Nexus, SonarQube, Bitbucket.
Have implemented & well versed with digital/internet web technologies like RESTful Web Services, SOAP Web Services, ESB, JSON, XML, JSON Schemas, XML Schemas, HTML5, HTTP, FTP and JavaScript.
Exposure in design and development of database tables, indexing, query and must have working experience using both SQL & No-SQL databases and DB integration with Application.
Experience working & maintaining databases like MYSQL or Maria DB. Database experience hosted on cloud is a plus.
Experience in use of project management and collaboration tools is required (E.g. Microsoft Project, Confluence, Jira Software, Kanban Boards, etc.)

Job Description:
As part of our recruiting process, we would like to request all interested applicants to apply directly through TD's Careers Site at:
https://td.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/TD_Bank_Careers/job/Solutions-IT-Designer---Oracle-KYC_R_1364264

Department Overview:
Residing within Enterprise Protect organization, the Global Anti-Money Laundering (GAML) Technology team is responsible for the delivery and support of technology solutions for the respective GAML business unit. Given the ongoing pace of regulatory change and ongoing importance of risk management, this is a fast-growing area within the bank translating into considerable demand and growth within its technology teams.

Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.

TD Applications & Systems Development covers technical planning, integration, systems analysis, design, development, unit and component systems testing, support-maintenance, and more. Meaningful, effective relationship-building is part of what these highly skilled experts do best as they work together with technology project managers, delivery partners, business and systems analysts, testing and quality assurance teams, sponsors and so many other stakeholders to clarify requirements.

Job Description:

About This Role
We are looking for a senior designer for our Customer Risk Rating solution to bring Oracle KYC design, development and delivery into the TD Technology Solutions team. You will also have the opportunity to provide technical guidance and leadership beyond your immediate project on significant strategic initiatives to modernize the technology and capabilities to align with the portfolio and enterprise technology roadmaps.
The primary responsibility of our team is to design, develop and maintain the technology platform that processes the banks payments through behaviour detection algorithms to detect suspicious and fraudulent activity. The open role is for a person who is very familiar with Oracle OFSAA KYC application development and maintenance. The hire will work with AML compliance business stakeholders to understand requirements and then work on designing and developing solutions on these KYC application modules.
Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:
Responsible for the development and design for Oracle KYC applications, providing both leadership and technical guidance.
Operate as the senior designer with the offshore (SGT time zone) development team to build environments, new solutions, and support all escalated incidents and defects, within defined SLA.
Provide input into OFSAA KYC solution architecture
Work closely with support manager on issues pertaining to solution design and complex solution defect fixes
Work with vendor (e.g. Oracle) when needed to review and/or collaborate on solution design
Work with technology partners to ensure that environment modifications interact appropriately, data conversion impacts are considered, and other areas of impact are addressed and meet performance requirements.
Ensure scheduled changes take place with proper testing, monitoring, and implementation and with little or no adverse impact to the business.
Oversee the integration of all systems, projects and technical interfaces to ensure a high level of service and support to the client and efficient system operation.
Lead effort to test, debug, and performance analyze and document environment components.
Foster an environment and culture that encourages productivity, innovation, process improvement, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism.
Act as an escalation point for all risks and issues affecting the development team, and for working to define and implement mitigation strategies.
Identify all development related project dependencies and risks and ensures mitigation/contingency plans are in place for identified risks.
Job Requirements:

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
University degree, preferably in technology/ engineering
Minimum of 5 years of in-depth experience working with AML Systems using Oracle KYC modules.
Excellent understanding of KYC Risk calculations
Very good understanding of the underlying Oracle OFSAA and FCCM data model and schema.
Very good understanding of how a typical OFSAA KYC batch works to generate alerts and be able to resolve issues arising from batches in a timely fashion
Excellent understanding of KYC party related reference data , the associated attributes and their usage for risk calculations.
At least 8 plus years of experience with architecting and delivering large scale enterprise grade applications preferably in Financial Services
Very good experience working with PL/SQL on Oracle database is required
Exposure to big data and analytics platforms on Hadoop or on data lake platforms on the public cloud is a big plus
Strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to forge strong relationships with key business partners, understand financial markets and regulation and apply analytics to drive commercial value

Job Description:
One of our esteemd clients is seeking a Project Manager for Cloud Migration to lead the seamless migration of on-premises infrastructure and applications to AWS Cloud. In this role, you will be at the forefront of their digital transformation, ensuring smooth execution of cloud migration projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and driving impactful business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead Cloud Migration: Plan, coordinate, and manage cloud migration projects, ensuring that objectives, timelines, and budgets are met from on-premises to AWS Cloud.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with solution architects, cloud architects, IT, and business stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables in alignment with business needs.
Risk Mitigation: Identify and mitigate risks throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.
Develop Migration Roadmaps: Manage the development and execution of comprehensive migration roadmaps, covering applications, databases, and data migration.
Team Leadership: Lead project teams, ensuring resources are effectively allocated, dependencies are identified, and bottlenecks are resolved.
Security Compliance: Ensure that migration strategies comply with AWS security standards, policies, and best practices.
Communication & Reporting: Provide regular updates to senior management and stakeholders on project status, risks, and mitigation strategies.
Post-Migration Stability: Monitor post-migration performance and ensure the stability and optimization of AWS cloud infrastructure.
What We Are Looking For:
Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
Project Management Experience: At least 8 years of experience in managing IT projects, with a strong preference for GCC (Government Commercial Cloud) migration experience.
Cloud Expertise: In-depth knowledge of AWS cloud services such as EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM, and security best practices.
Migration Leadership: Proven experience managing large-scale infrastructure migration projects, particularly from on-premises to cloud environments.
Project Methodologies: Strong understanding of Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies.
Technical Tools: Experience with cloud automation tools, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation) is a plus.
Leadership & Communication: Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills to drive projects to success.
Certifications: AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified Developer) are an added advantage.

Job Title: Healthcare Quality & Regulatory Compliance Advisor - AMEA
Job Description:
Mon to Fri 8.30am - 6pm

Position Summary
This position play a critical role in driving compliance and quality programs for Healthcare Transportation & Facilities and supporting the Healthcare Quality Management System to ensure processes and systems are compliant with regional and local regulations and customer requirements.

Job Scope
1. Quality Policies & Procedures: Determine, implement & promote policies and procedures for company’s Network and facilities (hubs & stations) to ensure compliance to standards such as GDP, GCP and others.
2. Quality Assessment & Standards: Write & review SOPs and Work Instructions for transportation & fulfilment solutions pertaining to the healthcare industry.
3. Compliance & Quality Program Management: Implement compliance and quality programs to support local Quality teams to ensure they are kept up-to-date and prepared.
4. CAPA Process Management: Lead in process creation and review of documentation on the implementation and responses to corrective and preventive actions (CAPAs) and monitor action progress until closure.
5. Healthcare Quality Management System: Develop, implement & support the system and processes, develop corresponding training programs, and acts as Super User for eQMS system.
6. Internal Audit Programs: Design & implement robust internal audit processes to ensure readiness of various functions & processes when meeting regulatory agencies & customer audits.
7. Certification Audits: Lead various certification audits with relevant regulatory agencies and certification providers across the region.
8. Operations & Customer Audit Programs: Lead & prepare for regular audit programs / random checks / regulatory activities to achieve successful audit outcomes and proper post audit follow up actions.
9. Healthcare Customer Liaison: Liaise with customers to understand quality requirements / issues / underlying concerns to advise on the way forward, provide advice based on interpretations as applicable to 3PL and resolve issues via conducting root cause analysis.
10. Healthcare Quality Feedback: Liaise, consolidate feedback from different functions to update and prepare final copy for Quality Questionnaires, Agreements and RFQ Proposals for customers.
11. Validation Programs: Lead the validation of transportation lanes and critical equipment like cold chain facilities, and packaging systems.
12. Depot Support: Provide secondary / backup support to healthcare specialists for market depots.

Requirements :
1. Hold local pharmacist license
2. Have at least five (5) years of relevant experience in warehouse, quality + QMS for pharmaceutical / healthcare industry
3. Have competencies in quality assurance / regulatory affairs, customer relationship management and root cause analysis
4. Have working experience ensuring compliance in accordance to Goods Manufacturing Practise cGMP,)/, Good Clinical Practises cGCP, Goods Distribution Practice (GDP) & ISO13485 for Medical Devices, IATA CEIV and other local certifications in a warehouse and transportation business.
5. Experience in conducting external and internal audits for regions
6. Must hold at least Bachelor’s degree in Pharmacy from a reputable local or Australia’s institute.
7. This position require to communicate with counter part in China
8. Occasionally travel is required to sites and region warehouses.

Competency
1. Accuracy & attention to detail which is crucial to proper compliance to regulatory and standards
2. Problem-solving skills to support customer issue resolution
3. Planning & organization skills to ensure proper audit programs are managed effectively
4. Communication skills to facilitate engagements with customer and regulatory agencies
5. Project management capabilities and familiarity with Process Mapping, Six Sigma, Lean Methodology, Agile or Design Thinking
6. Apply data-driven decision making with the use of data analytics and visualization tools like Power BI and competency in Microsoft Office applications like Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

Are you an accomplished leader with a proven track record in technical services and driving operational excellence? We are seeking a highly experienced APAC Technical Services Director to provide strategic leadership and direction for all aspects of Technical Services delivery for the Client Account across APAC.

Responsibilities:
Lead and oversee the delivery of all technical service lines to meet client requirements and objectives
Ensure full compliance with local, national, regional, and CBRE standards and legislation

Drive the implementation of CBRE Technical programs and best practices
Implement technology, standardization, and consistency across the account
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder relationships
Provide strategic guidance and leadership to the technical services teams
Required Leadership Skills:
Visionary Leadership: Ability to set a clear vision and inspire teams towards achieving goals
Strategic Thinking: Demonstrate broad knowledge and perspective in supporting regional strategies
Decision-Making Excellence: Make informed decisions based on experience, judgment, and critical analysis
Conflict Resolution: Approach conflicts as opportunities and effectively resolve them
Inspirational Leadership: Maintain a positive outlook and motivate teams in challenging environments
Courageous Decision-Making: Face difficult truths, set rigorous standards, and make complex decisions
Business Acumen: Comprehend and analyze complex business documents, respond effectively to sensitive issues, and solve advanced problems
Effective Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to influence and persuade stakeholders
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Develop and implement strategic initiatives to drive technical service excellence aligned with the customer's objectives
Collaborate with subject matter experts to drive best practices and processes within the account
Continuously improve the quality, cost-effectiveness, and performance of Technical Services delivery
Identify and pursue new opportunities for growth and innovation across the Client account in APAC

Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to motivate teams and drive operational excellence
Strong customer relationship management experience and a customer-centric mindset
Excellent financial management skills, including budgeting, forecasting, and cost optimization
Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities

If you are a visionary leader with a passion for driving technical services excellence and have a proven ability to lead and transform organizations, we want to hear from you. Apply now for the APAC Technical Services Director role and join our dynamic team!

Job Title: Deputy Department Head of Environmental Energy Business Development in Singapore Branch
Job Description:
The main objective of the department is i) to develop new business opportunities in next generation energy field, such as hydrogen, ammonia, carbon credit, methanol, sustainable aviation fuel, through deep collaboration with the colleagues in Tokyo HQ as well as in the Asia Pacific region, and ii) to assist Chief Regional Officer in the Asia Pacific region, General Manager and Acting General Manager in Singapore Branch office, and subsidiaries of its business-related activities.
In doing so, as a Deputy Department Head, you will be required to lead the team, collaborate with colleagues in Tokyo HQ and branch offices in the Asia Pacific region as well as our group companies in the region, and build/develop networks with the local counterparts and government authorities where necessary, in order to explore business opportunities related to hydrogen and carbon credit field in the region. The expected roles include but not limited to the followings:

· To lead and manage activities of the Hydrogen team in Environmental Energy Business Department in Singapore Branch.
· To lead and manage activities of the Carbon Management team in Environmental Energy Business Department in Singapore Branch.
· To create new business models/projects in hydrogen and carbon credit field in the Asia Pacific region, which shall be aligned with the Company’s direction and Environmental Energy Group’s business strategies.
· To gather and analyze information and reports to identify global and local market trends, as well as new destinations and growth opportunities in hydrogen, carbon credit, and relevant business industries in the Asia Pacific region.
· To establish strong relationships with existing and prospective business partners, consultants, bankers, government authorities, etc. in the Asia Pacific region for potential business opportunities and gathering of market intelligence.
· To lead and manage good interactions with diverse groups of stakeholders, with the objective of forming possible business partnerships and commercializing projects.
· To guide, train, develop and motivate a diverse group of team members in Singapore branch office as well as in the other Asia Pacific region branch offices, and communicating in English & Japanese for effective team management.

Job Requirements
· Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or equivalent.
· Skills, expertise and experiences to research, develop and deploy new business in relation to Energy business, especially for hydrogen and carbon credit.
· Strong Knowledge on investment and project finance practice.
· Well-versed on sustainable solutions, ESG and SDGs.
· High proficiency in Japanese and English (listening, speaking and writing) to communicate effectively through phone calls, video conference, emails and/or meetings with Tokyo HQ, Mitsubishi Corporation’s group companies and/or local and/or Japanese staff.
· Skills to prepare effective presentation materials both in Japanese and English, in order to communicate effectively with customers and/or for internal approval.
· Cross cultural efficacy to facilitate effective communication with Tokyo HQ, subsidiaries and department staff in Singapore and other Asia Pacific region.
· More than 10 years’ experience in abovementioned requirements.

Job Description:
Role Overview:
The Public Relations Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of public relations, marketing, and communications to enhance the visibility and reputation of our establishment. This individual will develop and execute strategies to drive foot traffic, engage customers, and create a strong brand presence.

Key Responsibilities:
Marketing Strategy: Develop and implement marketing campaigns that promote the wine bar and restaurant, focusing on driving sales and increasing brand awareness.
Customer Interaction: Engage with restaurant customers on-site, ensuring they have a positive and personalized experience. Address any concerns, provide recommendations, and gather feedback.
Guest Relations: Act as the point of contact for VIP guests, regular customers, and special events, ensuring all their needs are met during their visit.
Public Relations Strategy Execution: Assist in executing the restaurant's public relations strategy, including promoting special events, new menus, and collaborations with influencers.
Event Hosting: Assist with in-restaurant events such as wine tastings, special dinners, and private events. Ensure smooth communication between the staff and guests.
Customer Feedback: Collect and report guest feedback to management, suggesting improvements where necessary to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.
On-Site Content Creation: Capture moments from the restaurant, including events and special occasions, for use in social media and campaigns.
Qualifications:
Previous experience in Public Relations, guest relations, or a similar customer-facing role, preferably within the F&B or hospitality industry.
Basic knowledge of restaurant operations and the ability to understand customer preferences.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage guests and provide outstanding service.
Knowledge of wine and fine dining is a plus.
A positive attitude and passion for delivering exceptional guest experiences.
