When you’re part of the team here, you’ll do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues, you’ll have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected, growing organization has an outstanding strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team, and help give to the world.
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $40 billion. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies, or growing efficiency in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer with a team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivering an unrivalled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD! For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

Summary:
The facilities supervisor plays a key role to implement the company’s Facilities, Maintenance and Security Programs at the Capricorn commercial office. This position will anticipate, plan, budget, and schedule facilities programs, lead and implement site renovations, layout updates, maintenance/repair of site infrastructure and mechanical, electrical & plumbing (MEP) systems, as well as closely partner across functions with our Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) teams to ensure safety, environmental compliance, and sustainability efforts. The Candidate will be in direct contact with the Real Estate Facilities Management (REFM) Team and report to and coordinate with on lease issues, major projects, campus construction, infrastructure repairs and other matters.

Responsibilities:
This role will be strategic in our commercial office in Capricorn as follows.
Take lead in day-to-day facilities operations and maintenance activities.
Work closely with key commercial office as functional customers
Liaise with landlord estate management for necessary supports.
Maintain drawings for workplace layout, mechanical & electrical.
Collaborate with procurement team to identify, select, and handle contractors for execution of facilities maintenance, improvement works and new/exiting leasehold improvement activities.
Plan, establish and lead improvement initiatives with good collaboration with EHS and other functions.
Plan, support and establish projects to improve facilities, upgrade infrastructure, etc.
Seek approvals from landlord for leasehold improvements.
Prepare annual operation budget plan.
Work with facilities coordinator to run general administrative services including cleaning, housekeeping, meeting & event supports & office supplies.
Handle security service including access control and CCTV.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field, and/or Facilities Management Certificate.
Demonstrates more than 5 years shown experiences in facility management.
Familiar with HVAC and M&E systems in the commercial space.
Ability to work and coordinate numerous activities within a multi-disciplinary team who need to communicate and collaborate to achieve success.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Highly effective social skills and presentation skills.
Ability to used ACAD drawings.
Ability to lead a small team of technical & outsourced personnel.
Be a change agent and lead change.
Have a continuous improvement demeanor.

Job Description:
Position Purpose

• Provide guidance and day-to-day training to staff within assigned area

• Carry out day-to-day operations in managing floor control to maintain & improve quality, service cleanliness & ambience

• Manage and coordinate activities with people, products and equipment to maximize sales and profit

Responsibilities

Restaurant Operations

• Lead a team of service staff within assigned unit by allocating tasks and roles for individuals in the service team

• Check readiness of restaurant for service day and brief service crew on staffing roster for service day

• Manage customer flow and seating arrangement

• Oversee the service rendered by the team to ensure it meets the quality, service, cleanliness and values standards and to address lapses in service quality when necessary

• Manage cash floats, audit rolls, and provide technical troubleshoot for cash register errors when necessary

• Ensure documentation of all cash shortage and surplus in record book and to tally payment collection

Restaurant Management & Planning

• Act as point of escalation for service crew regarding service issues

• Resolve day-to-day operation issues as and when it occurs and to provide support as necessary to ensure service crew are able to carry out assigned task

• Lead investigation and resolution of all complex customer complaints and/or feedback in a timely and efficient manner

Quality Assurance & Control

• Enforce restaurant quality, service, cleanliness and value standards

• Monitor operations to ensure compliance with all safety procedures and guidelines in the restaurant

• Implement corrective actions to resolve unsafe and/or non-compliant conditions and behaviors regarding personal and food safety

People Management

• Conduct induction for new hires to provide them with the necessary skills and information to carry out roles and functions

• Provide training to encourage role rotation amongst service staff

• Train and monitor staff in the company SOPs (standard operating procedures)

• Ensure workplace safety practicesPosition Purpose

• Carry out day-to-day operations in managing floor control to maintain & improve quality, service cleanliness & ambience

Job Description:
Our client is actively searching for Deputy Director, Advancement to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

The responsibilities of this role are:

Reporting to Director, Advancement Office, this position will be responsible for creating and driving effective fundraising strategies, developing gift opportunities, managing a portfolio of prospective and existing donors, and building strong philanthropic relationships for the University. The candidate should have good interpersonal skills to foster and build good relationships between the Institute and Donor. The candidate must be a Team player who is highly motivated and initiated to drive goals to fruition.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement effective fundraising strategies to match University's mission and fundraising expectations.
Develop gift opportunities and create proposals that match the interest of possible donors (Businesses, Individuals and Community Leaders) with the needs of the University
Steward, maintain and strengthen University's relationships with prospective and existing donors through active participation in:
Support the Division's gift solicitation pipeline and follow-up on the closing of gift/s by assisting in the drafting of Gift Proposal/s and Gift Agreements.
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:

Job Requirements
Degree with 15 years of relevant working experience in higher education and fund raising or similar.
A self-starter who can operate with a high degree of independence
An excellent track record in fundraising, preferably in university advancement, and good networking with industries or a good track record of leading fundraising campaigns and initiatives.
Requires strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
A team player with good engagement skills, including listening, negotiating and presenting.
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Description:
About the Company/School:
We are a fast-growing fully funded start-up in the education industry. We are launching an innovative international school in Singapore that offers a world-class education focusing on global citizenship and academic excellence. We are founded by a Forbes Top 30 under 30 entrepreneur and a group of top U.S. educational experts.


Job Overview:
We are seeking a Director of Human Resources who will be instrumental in leading our HR department. This individual will develop and oversee comprehensive HR strategies that support the school’s vision and growth. The Director of Human Resources will ensure that all HR operations are conducted in compliance with Singapore’s employment laws and regulations, catering to both local and international staff members. Candidates with previous experience in managing office Administration function is a strong plus.


Key Responsibilities:
· Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives that align with the overall business strategy of the school.
· Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues.
· Manage the recruitment and selection process to ensure it is compliant with local laws and effectively meets the needs of the school for both local and expatriate staff.
· Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance and professional development.
· Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management, particularly regarding Singapore employment standards and practices for both local and foreign employees.
· Develop and implement policies for staff welfare, including health and safety, equal opportunities, anti-discriminatory practices, and proper handling of grievances.
· Administer employee benefits, payroll, and not limited to compensation plans.
· Provide decision support through HR metrics and ensure systems are in place to collect and maintain reliable data.
· Manage budgets and forecasts pertaining to the HR department.
· Lead the HR staff and further their professional development within the department.

Qualifications:
· Relevant educational background or training in human resources, business administration, law, or a related field is preferred.
· Strong ability to execute projects.
· At least 7 years of experience in human resources, with at least 3 years in a leadership role. Experience in the education sector is desirable.
· Extensive understanding of employment laws and regulations in Singapore, applicable to both Singaporean citizens and foreign employees.
· Proven experience in HR practices and employee management, including an understanding of best practices in recruitment and selection, compensation, organizational planning, employee relations, and employee development.
· Strong interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills with the ability to interact effectively at all levels within the school.
· Excellent leadership qualities and the ability to foster a healthy workplace environment.
· Proficient in HRIS systems, MS Office Suite, and comfortable handling large sets of data.
· Outstanding organizational and time-management abilities.
· Ability to speak Chinese/Mandarin is an advantage.

Why Join Us:
· Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
· Opportunity to work in a dynamic and culturally diverse setting.
· Significant impact on the school's growth and success.

Application Process:
Interested candidates are invited to submit a detailed resume, full bio-data, recent photo, cover letter, and references.
The cover letter should outline your experience and expertise as a Director of Human Resources if available.
We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Provide expertise in mapping sales, service, and customer management processes across domains to identify integration points and data exchange requirements
Work closely with Group IT to develop and implement interfaces and data migration strategies between SAP SD/CS and external systems
Conduct testing, validation, and documentation of the integrated solutions to ensure they meet business requirements and comply with best practices
Participate in CAB, regular meetings, and discussions with Local and Group IT teams to share updates, gather feedback, and align on project timelines and deliverables
Provide training and support to end-users on the integrated systems, to ensure smooth adoption and utilization

Experience in coordinating with technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure successful integration projects
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
SAP certifications in SD and CS modules are a plus
Experience in data migration and system interfaces is desirable

Headquartered in Singapore, Actxa Pte Ltd is a deep tech company founded in 2015 that leverages artificial intelligence to create next generation preventive healthcare solutions.

We create evidence-based, personalised health insights in the domains of physical activities, sleep quality, body composition, stress and recovery, heart health and blood glucose evaluation and monitoring.

To improve population health, Actxa establishes worldwide partnerships and research collaborations to develop critical preventive health models to help people avert chronic diseases such as diabetes and hypertension.

Experience or knowledge of fundraising, merger and acquisition, or corporate finance would be an advantage.

Job Description:
Based in Singapore, Barclyne College International has been grooming students for success since 1995 through our 3 educational divisions: Barclyne School of Foundation Studies, Barclyne School of Business, and Barclyne School of Language through various AEIS preparatory, ACCA, professional developmental, and language programmes.

We are looking for a full time Business Development Director to join our team during this exciting restructuring phase of our company to lead our team to maximize our reach to potential clients from all walks of life and backgrounds based on their educational growth journeys, and leading the business to our goal of being one of the top premium choice of international institutions in Singapore.

You will be a key representative of our company, planning and strategizing on how to position our brand, and execute strategies to maximize different channels to showcase our educational programs to potential clients, helping potential students to make informed decisions towards their next step in life, creating a positive impact in their lives.
Job Scope:
Become proficient in our educational program offerings to create informative and accurate strategies for our team to pitch our products and services to potential clients
Help to shape the company’s long-term objectives and determine plans for how to meet them.
Identify and develop new business opportunities.
Build relationships with customers, suppliers, distributors, partners, and vendors.
Evaluate existing partnerships and sales efforts with an eye toward building on what works and changing what doesn’t.
Be able to strategize and execute implementation of activities and events to align with our branding and business goals
A good understanding of international marketing trends to position our brand internationally
Responding to market demands and consumer’s comments to consistently make suggestions to improve our company’s products and services
Lead sales, marketing, customer-service, and client relationship management teams.
Plan, strategize, and execute business development and marketing plans through social media such as Linkedin, Facebook, Tiktok videos or Xiao Hong Shu videos.
Conduct webinars and presentations to raise the brand or product profile.
Reporting directly to our Managing Director
Job requirements:
- Permanent full-time position
- All racial demographics are welcomed
- Ability to speak and understand Mandarin to handle clients’ enquiries and showcase presentations in spoken Mandarin.
- Minimum 3years of experience in the Educational Consultancy sector
- Minimum 5years of experience in a leading or management role
- Familiar with the student recruitment process in Singapore
- Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in any relevant fields related to Education, Business, or Marketing.
- Ability to use Microsoft Excel, words, and powerpoint.

Job Description:
Position Description

Senior Product Manager
Permanent Full Time
Location: Singapore

About the Role
We are on the hunt for a passionate and experienced Product Leader who dreams of creating solutions our customers adore and making waves in the maritime industry. As the captain of a team of brilliant Product Managers, you'll skilfully navigate the balance between customer value and business benefit. You'll collaborate with talented individuals across our business and industry to uncover opportunities and deliver products that truly make an impact.
This isn't just about steering the ship; you'll also dive into the action, rolling up your sleeves to get things done. If you thrive on blending strategic thinking with hands-on execution, this role is your perfect adventure!

Key Responsibilities
Leadership: Mentor a high-performing team of product managers, guided by product vision, strategy, and roadmaps. Ensure the team has clear objectives and is equipped and enabled to succeed.
Strategy: Oversee/conduct market research and leverage customer feedback to inform product decisions. Identify opportunities to evolve product strategy and roadmaps with clear business cases and ROI.
Delivery: Oversee the delivery of product opportunities. Formulate GTM strategies for successful product launches and market penetration. At times, drive execution of GTM for more complex opportunities.
Metrics: Define and track KPIs, regularly communicate product metrics, and manage follow-up actions. Analyse product performance for continuous improvement. Manage product budgets, timelines, and resources efficiently.
Collaboration: Collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, sales, and customer support for successful product and GTM execution. Partner with commercial teams and executives to deliver impactful solutions. Support the CPO as the product team's voice internally and externally.
Skills and Knowledge
A highly experienced and strategic leader, motivated and resilient, with a proven track record in scaling SaaS products to success. Exceptional in guiding product vision, strategy, and team development.
Experience: 7+ years in senior product management roles with extensive experience in end-to-end product and lifecycle management.
Strategic Leadership: Expert in driving and aligning actions with business goals and overarching product strategy with proven ability to develop and execute long-term product visions.
Commercial Savvy: Deep understanding of market dynamics with a strong focus on revenue generation and profitability.
People Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead, mentor, and develop high-performing product management teams. Strong stakeholder management skills and ability to foster robust customer relationships.
Analytical Abilities: Expertise in data analysis, deriving actionable insights, and impact modelling to inform decision-making.
Technical Expertise: Significant experience collaborating with technical teams, with a strong foundation in technical knowledge.
Adaptability: High resilience and capability to navigate and lead through ambiguity and change.
Research Skills: Advanced proficiency in market research and sensing to accurately understand and anticipate customer needs and market trends.

Job Description:
Patient Service Associate in Urgent Care Centre (UCC)
The role
You will be responsible for the delivery of friendly and efficient customer service and creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all internal and external customers / patients. The key aim of the role is to provide excellent patient care and satisfaction, and also to contribute to the smooth operations of the hospital
Job Responsibilities
Ensure department’s operational readiness. Ensure that workstations are kept tidy and clean at all times. Ensure sufficient stationery stock is maintained in the department.
Assist with smooth patient journey including:
Registration of patients, and updating of NOK contacts
Attending to and managing patients’ enquiries
Assisting with admission process, which includes financial counselling and monitoring of bed request status
Discharging of patients which includes system discharge, scheduling of appointments and payment collection.
Providing value-added value services that contributed to the smooth operations of the department and overall staff and patient satisfaction.
Ensuring accurate and timely registration and promote the usage of self-help kiosk.
Provide administrative assistance in the daily operations and department events.
Perform any other ad-hoc duties and responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time.
Requirements
Minimum GCE “O” Levels qualification or equivalent.
Proficient in computer skills (Microsoft Office), handling multiple systems such as SAP will be an advantage.
Team player with good communication, customer service and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak a second language will be an advantage.
Able to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment.
Candidates should be comfortable/flexible with working in a hospital setting and in different clinics when needed. Prior experience in hospitality or service industries will be an advantage.
Working schedule: 5 days’ work week (Monday to Sunday, inclusive of Public Holidays), on 3 rotating shifts (morning, afternoon and midnight). AM: 730 to 330pm, PM:130-930pm, Night: 9pm-8am
This is a 2-year contract role, subjected to contract extension or permanent conversion with satisfactory work performance.
Salary: up to $2400
Working location: Central Singapore

Job Description:
Find Out Even More At: https://tinyurl.com/operations-bd-intern-mindflex
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Hi! Our company is looking for University/Polytechnic Interns who are able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 Months & Above (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships that are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun and encouraging. We take our work, as well as our play seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a cosy office environment with modern facilities such as a PS5, pool table, karaoke system & more
Close-knit team of 15-25 pax, strictly no over-time culture, no bring-work-home culture
Attractive part-time positions ($14/Hour & above) and full-time positions available after completion of internship
Learning Scope:
Client Relations
Take charge of handling tuition requests via Forms & WhatsApp
Ask clients the right questions to gather information efficiently
Address clients' queries and concerns that they might have
Transfer clients' requirements into a concise job-post format
Provide after-sales service to clients (and tutors)
Monthly check-in on existing client base for any feedback, staying connected and maintaining good relations with them
Tutor Relations:
Broadcasting assignments via automated outreach channels (Email, Telegram, etc.) to our database of 50,000+ tutors
Apply filters (eg. Location, Tutor Type, Qualifications) to tag each assignment to the correct target audience
Assist in profiling, and marketing tutors in a way which captures the client's attention based on their needs
Assist tutors with technical issues & application processing
Clarification of agency's commission & policies to tutors
Business to Business (B2B):
Take charge of MindFlex's B2B arm and work with tuition centres, government agencies & educational institutes.
Schedule interviews (phonecall, online, face-to-face) between tutors and organisations
Manage confirmation contracts & invoices for clients
Internal Processes:
Work with customised back-end software, specially designed to fulfill the company's business needs & improve efficiency
Maintain cohesive inter-department and intra-department relations, ensure good customer handover between colleagues
Take charge of designating clients to various teams (traffic control), depending on each team's existing workload
Maintain an organised record of clients for different departments to contact and follow-up with in future
Business Development:
Analyse company's past data and trends, to forecast peak periods and develop relevant plans
Active participation in Business Development meetings to brainstorm for process streamlining and automation
1-to-1 & consultations with MindFlex's upper management on strategy building for the company's operations
Brainstorm & develop new streams of revenue for the company with Business Development Manager
Execute Business Development plans in a strategic manner
Key Takeaways:
Hone fast-thinking abilities and good decision-making skills
Build professional communication and customer service skills
Develop confident problem-solving and mediation skills
Learn to stay organised, meticulous and calm in a fast-paced environment
Become an effective team-player and an independent worker
Witness firsthand how SMEs create their own in-house software and solutions (from conceptualistion to development to usage)
Deep involvement and familiarisation in both back-end and front-end processes of the company & industry
Exposure to real-world data and applications, that puts theory into practice
Last but not least, private mentoring & sharing sessions with company's founders and management (P.S. we love sharing)
Job Requirements:
Current University/Polytechnic Student, Singaporean/PR
Good Command of Both Written & Verbal English
Friendly, Passionate and Energetic Team Player
Organized and Good Administrative Skills
Responsible and Strong Work Ethic
Decent Typing Speed and Computer Skills
Polite, Patient and Calm Personality
Location & Working Hours:
Location: Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Near Bishan/Marymount MRT)
4 Weekdays, 1 Weekend, 9.00am - 6.30pm
(Working days of your choosing & mutually agreed with the company)
Strictly No Overtime and No Bring-Work-Home Culture
Internship Allowance:
$1,000-$1,300/Month
Why Choose Us:
Fun Company Culture and Working Environment
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-25 Pax
Office with Modern Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games, etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep
Application:
Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Internship Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:
1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:
Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

Job Title: Business Analyst / Program Manager (Futures & Derivatives) up to $9.1K
Job Description:
The Opportunity
Adecco is partnering with a leading bank to look for Business Analyst for Futures & Derivatives Clearing
Focus: Provide PM/ BA support for front to back control review in futures and derivatives clearing.
Starts off as a contract till 31 Dec 2025
Location: CBD
The Talent
At least 6 years experience in FX and Derivatives
Experience in Data Analysis, tracing cash events through multiple systems front to back.
Experience in delivering Operational process improvements and controls
Track record as a Business Analyst/ Program manager within the Financial Services/Investment Banking industry.
Knowledge of Markets Operations businesses/ functions is required. Knowledge & understanding of workflows and controls beneficial.
Knowledge on Futures and Options products and Clearing industry is a plus.
Strong communication skills to enable the capture of current state and target state processes, challenges and requirements
Ability to work independently, multi-task, have great attention to detail and take ownership of various parts of a project or initiative.
Able to lead conference calls and produce meeting agendas, materials, and minutes.
Have experience of leading User Acceptance Testing (UAT) projects, including overseeing the development & implementation of the UAT test plan, scripts and tools using the detailed functional requirements document.
Must be extremely organized, motivated and a self-starter.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task is key.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to clearly document findings and put together proposals for solutions.
Excellent Excel, Powerpoint and process mapping skillsets required.
Ability to work in fast paced environment under tight contractual deadlines.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to communicate to a range of audiences and facilitate discussions.
Willingness to ask questions, challenge the process and seek out answers.
The Job
Provide PM/ BA support for front to back control review in futures and derivatives clearing.
Perform root cause analysis of control gaps in the operations team.
Documentation of project artefacts, including, Target Operating Models, BRDs, User Stories, Test Cases
Support Ops SME’s in determining, identifying, and remediating the control gaps and documenting them.
Deliver requirements, prepare testing plans if any and execute/oversee testing and development of associated project artifacts as required for deliverables.
Day-to-day management of individual project responsibilities including milestone setting, task and actions management, co-ordination, and execution of plan within required timelines and to stakeholder quality expectations.
Assess and manage risk and issues.
Support and manage business ad-hoc queries and requirements.
Foster and maintain relationships with business and technology stakeholders and support engagement in working groups, steercos, and workshops where required.
Identify key project risks, whether stated or not, and manage to resolution or escalate accordingly.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy and can operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information.
Next Step
We could contact you in the soonest time if you directly send your resume to: kareen.chua@adecco.com
Email Topic: Apply Business Analyst (FX & Derivatives)
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

Job Title: CMI / Post-Trade IT / TSY - Treasury Support
Job Description:
Position
Embark on a transformative career journey as a Production Support Expert in our Capital Market Department! Join a forward-thinking team committed to revolutionizing financial technology.
As a Support specialist, you will be immersed in real life production systems, that shape and devise the future of capital markets IT. Unleash your creativity, collaborate with industry leaders, and drive innovation that sets new standards. This is your chance to be a catalyst for change and make your mark in the dynamic world of capital markets. You will have the support and guidance of identified subject matter experts, dedicated communities, as well as established leaders.
You will be working on Treasury/ALM applications and taking care of day-to-day BAU operations (L1/L2) of multiple apps. You will be closely associated with business and be a contact point to provide functional and technical support on Kondor+ platform as well as other in-house developed systems serving TSY and ALM operations. You will also liaise with business analysis and development teams to plan and manage priorities, highlight blockers and critical issues.
You will also be instrumental in optimizing the current procedures, ensure system resiliency with strong focus on continuous improvement. Provide support and mentor junior staff. Align yourself with bank’s initiatives and strategies.

Main responsibilities
Provide functional and technical expertise on KONDOR+ and other in-house bank applications.
Requests management (users and others IT teams)
Operations management
Application monitoring
Incident Management
Problem Management
Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
Must be able to mentor new/junior resources, impart knowledge and collaborate effectively within TSY and whole CMI.
Self-motivated and starter with demonstrated ability to lead initiatives explore latest market standards and tools to gain time and cost efficiency.
Flexibility to accept additional responsibilities and be able to multi-task.
The Support analyst should have a pro-active mindset in security, incident preventive measures, productivity and global improvement of the quality of service.
Must be flexible to participate in post business hours activities such as but not limited to overnight on-calls, weekend interventions, DRP, releases and other application activities that can be performed only outside the business duration/weekends.
Qualifications and Profile
Key Skills
Candidates should have (5-7) years of experience in Production Support of financial systems.
Master degree or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Strong knowledge on KONDOR+ application for 3+ years or 3+ years of experience in IT Support for another Capital Markets applications
Candidates should have ITIL certification/knowledge.
Knowledge of major market regulatory body’s rules is an advantage
Exposure to Capital Markets applications (E.g. Summit, Kondor+, Murex, Calypso…) is an advantage
Should be able to do SLA & KPI management, Client communication & interaction
Predictive analysis, consulting, escalation management
Risk analysis and project execution
Knowledge in Capital Market FO/BO environment is an advantage
Strong knowledge in Configuration Management
Strong knowledge in XML, SQL, PL/SQL, Shell Scripting, MQ Series, CFT and Control-M.
Knowledge of monitoring solution like ITRS Geneos is an advantage
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office
Careful observance of standards and processes
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical or troubleshooting skills
Ability to work well under pressure
Autonomous, self-motivated and excellent team player
Strong perseverance and diligence towards attaining goals and effective time management
Self-starter and ambitious
Other Professional Skills and Mindset
Strong passion for production support and resiliency.
Appetite to follow technology trend and participate to communities.
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a dynamic software development environment.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Effective communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team.

Job Title: CMI / Post-Trade IT / TSY - Treasury Support
Job Description:
Position
Embark on a transformative career journey as a Production Support Expert in our Capital Market Department! Join a forward-thinking team committed to revolutionizing financial technology.
As a Support specialist, you will be immersed in real life production systems, that shape and devise the future of capital markets IT. Unleash your creativity, collaborate with industry leaders, and drive innovation that sets new standards. This is your chance to be a catalyst for change and make your mark in the dynamic world of capital markets. You will have the support and guidance of identified subject matter experts, dedicated communities, as well as established leaders.
You will be working on Treasury/ALM applications and taking care of day-to-day BAU operations (L1/L2) of multiple apps. You will be closely associated with business and be a contact point to provide functional and technical support on Kondor+ platform as well as other in-house developed systems serving TSY and ALM operations. You will also liaise with business analysis and development teams to plan and manage priorities, highlight blockers and critical issues.
You will also be instrumental in optimizing the current procedures, ensure system resiliency with strong focus on continuous improvement. Provide support and mentor junior staff. Align yourself with bank’s initiatives and strategies.

Provide functional and technical expertise on KONDOR+ and other in-house bank applications.

Application monitoring
Incident Management
Problem Management

Self-motivated and starter with demonstrated ability to lead initiatives explore latest market standards and tools to gain time and cost efficiency.
Flexibility to accept additional responsibilities and be able to multi-task.
The Support analyst should have a pro-active mindset in security, incident preventive measures, productivity and global improvement of the quality of service.
Must be flexible to participate in post business hours activities such as but not limited to overnight on-calls, weekend interventions, DRP, releases and other application activities that can be performed only outside the business duration/weekends.

Job Description:
Opportunities to work on international deals
Global compliance and regulatory experience exposure
About Our Client
Our Client is an international financial institution and fin-tech service company.
Job Description
We are looking to hire a detail-oriented, hard-working Senior Legal Counsel to Global Compliance Policies team, responsible for cross-border government investigations/litigation. This person will work closely with U.S. regulators, in-house commercial lawyers, risk management, other legal/compliance professionals, as well as business and operations teams.
Responsibilities:
1. Support Global Compliance Policies and work closely with the other Legal and Compliance professionals, i.e., Legal, Compliance, AML, privacy, information security, risk management colleagues in the PRC and other jurisdictions, US-based business units, and other colleagues in the international and domestic business functions.
2. Responsible for coordinating responses to US/EMEA regulatory inquiries/investigations and leading compliance enhancement projects with various legal, compliance, and risk functions.
3. Develop compliance metrics and monitoring mechanisms to anticipate and ensure compliance with US state/federal regulator's requirements to mitigate regulatory risks.
4. Develop compliance training and communication programs and establish processes to ensure both existing and new employees are trained timely and adequately with respect to responses to government and regulatory compliance.
The Successful Applicant
1. Requirements:7-10 years of relevant legal and regulatory compliance experience. Strong skills in coordinating responses to regulatory inquiries and government investigations/litigation.
2. A team player and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with multiple teams located in different jurisdictions and under strict deadlines.
3. Excellent project management skills and sound judgement.
4. The ideal candidate will be a confident self-starter with strong legal, interpersonal and organizational skills, regulatory compliance/government litigation experience, and demonstrable ability to effectively and proactively engage and partner with the business in a fast-paced and engaging environment.5. Resourceful, adaptable and flexible in a highly engaging, demanding and rewarding environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
6. 10% travel within US, and China expected

Opportunities to work on international deals

Job Description:
Job scope:
The Marine Superintendent is responsible for ensuring the safe and smooth operations of his or her assigned Oil and Oil-Chemical Type tankers.

Responsibilities:
· To ensure that the vessels are able to perform their voyages and operations in accordance with Charterers Voyage Orders in strict compliance with owners policies and Procedures.
· To arrange and manage vetting inspections, including submissions onto the OCIMF SIRE online platform.
· Carry out on board and / or remote pre-vetting inspections of the assigned vessels.
· To oversee the vessels’ navigational matters, including review of passage plans and conduct of navigation audits.
· To ensure compliance with terminal, operators, oil majors and charterers’ requirements.
· To liaise with and manage matters in relation to Flag State and Port State.
· To ensure that Q88 and HVPQ are updated at all times.
· To advise on changes to regulations, requirements and industry best practices.
· To promote and manage the vessels’ health, safety and environment compliance.
· Plan and execute Ship visits of the assigned ships in close liaison with his seniors
· To assist GM in planning and materialising Crew changes in line with the requirements
· To provide suggestions for improvement of company’s SMS.
· To provide vessels with guidance and information regarding the above.
· To provide support, training and enforcement in respect of crew competency and discipline.
· To provide support in respect of queries regarding vessels’ capabilities and performances.
· Member of company’s emergency response team.
· Attend to various tasks as assigned by seniors related to job.
· Closely liaise and communicate with owners and charterers to ensure smooth operation of the vessels assigned.
· Cooperate with the Technical Superintendent in efficient running of the assigned vessels with the budget.

Requirements:
· Seagoing experience as a Master and Chief Officer on Oil and Oil-Chemical Tankers OR at least 2 years of shore experience in managing Oil Product and Oil-Chemical Tankers
· Experience in relation to safety, health and environment management and compliance for Oil and Oil-Chemical tankers.
· Additional sailing experience on pure chemical tankers will be beneficial
· Familiar with international and local maritime regulations and requirements.
· Result oriented person with strong sense of integrity and professionalism.
· Excellent leadership, teamwork, management and communication skills.
· Able to motivate and inspire people.
· Be proactive in approach with good decision making ability
· Good knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic computer skills
· Ready to travel at short notice

Job Title: 24793090 Officer : APAC FX Middle Office Analyst
Job Description:
Whether you’re at the start of your career or looking to discover your next adventure, your story begins here. At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your skills and make a difference at one of the world’s most global banks. We’re fully committed to supporting your growth and development from the start with extensive on-the-job training and exposure to senior leaders, as well as more traditional learning. You’ll also have the chance to give back and make a positive impact where we live and work through volunteerism.

This is an exciting opportunity to kick start your career at Citi! We are looking for enthusiastic and energetic team players, with a strong work ethic, who will join Markets Operations. The FX Middle Office Analyst is a mid level position within the APAC Middle Office team, part of the Markets Operations organization. This is a great opportunity to join a high-performing team that provides daily support to our Front Office and Clients. You will play an important part in helping to support the lifecycle of a trade by working closely with Business partners, Client’s, and internal stakeholders to ensure all transactions flow through our front to back Operations teams, with no issues. The overall objective of this role is to support the Front office desk, responsible for providing trade lifecycle support, performing and reviewing controls, trade exception and remediation.

Responsibilities:
Provide analytical and administrative support to Front Office Sales and Trading specifically related to FX business in Hub locations - Australia, Hong Kong and Singapore
Supporting lifecycle activities and interaction with Business, Firm’s Clients, Operations and Technology to manage post execution issues
Perform control functions based on intermediary processing systems and records
Complete daily tasks accurately and on time
Ensure the desk is in compliant with internal and external regulations at all times
Manage, escalate and resolve all requests / inquiries / issues / errors and identify policy gaps
Willingness to cross train across teams
Assist Team Lead in all their duties as required
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Require to work Australia shift on rotational basis
Qualification and Skills:
2-3 years relevant experience preferred, freshers will do.
Fundamental understanding of FX products, trade lifecycle management, and related operational risks
Team oriented personality, thrives in a team environment and can also work independently
Self-motivation, flexibility, and a strong desire to succeed
Proven ability to perform various concurrent activities/projects in a high-risk environment
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills

Education:
Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience preferred

Working at Citi is far more than just a job. A career with us means joining a family of more than 230,000 dedicated people from around the globe. At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, give back to your community and make a real impact.

Take the next step in your career, apply for this role at Citi today

Job Description:
Sales Assistant Manager Job Description
We are looking to employ a highly driven assistant sales manager to assist the sales manager with the day-to-day running of our store. The assistant sales manager’s responsibilities include developing strategies to improve sales, effectively handling customer complaints, and assisting with the recruitment of sales staff. You should also be able to delegate tasks to the sales staff in the absence of the sales manager.
To be successful as an assistant sales manager, you should demonstrate exceptional leadership skills and ensure that sales staff comply with company policies and guidelines. Ultimately, a top-performing assistant sales manager should be able to achieve excellent customer service at all times.
Sales Assistant Manager Responsibilities:
Continually meeting or exceeding sales quotas.
Supervising and guiding the sales team as well as providing incentives to motivate staff to achieve sales targets.
Monitoring the performance of the sales team.
Ensuring that the store is clean and well-maintained at all times.
Building and maintaining good working relationships with customers.
Identifying opportunities and strategies to increase sales.
Regularly attending sales meetings and training sessions.
Ensuring that the store is adequately stocked with company products.
Performing all duties of the Sales Manager in cases of absence or emergency.
Updates managers by consolidating, analysing, and forwarding daily action summaries.
Assist with the sales process by maintaining a fully stocked store.
Recommend and display items that match customer needs.
Manage point-of-sale processes.
Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of product features and sales promotion
Tracks sales expenses by tracking, consolidating, analysing, and summarising expenses, and forwarding for reimbursement.
Update customer records in the company database as required
Perform any other duties assigned by the director.
Sales Assistant Manager Requirements:
High school diploma or GED.
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or related field is advantageous.
Proven experience in sales and customer service.
Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications.
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong management and leadership skills.
Effective communication skills.
Exceptional customer service skills.
The Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
Availability to work within opening hours (e.g. evenings, holidays, weekends).
The ability to work under pressure.

Job Description:
Job Descriptions:
1. Lead the team to complete the design, simulation and design document writing of analog circuits and chips
2. Guide the layout and routing of the layout to improve the efficiency and quality of layout design
3. Assist in product testing, debugging and application
4. Guide the work of junior analog designers and write detailed design documents

Job Requirements:
1. Master's degree or above in microelectronics or electronic engineering with more than 10 years of working experience
2. Solid understanding and experience in designing analog mixed-signal circuit blocks, including bandgap, bias circuits, LDO regulators, amplifiers, comparators, switched capacitor circuits, ADCs, DACs, oscillators, filters, Tx/Rx equalization techniques and circuits such as de-emphasis, CTLE, DFE, CDR architecture and implementation, high-speed digital circuits (serializers, deserializers, counters, dividers, etc.)
3. Knowledge of common high-speed interface protocols (such as PCIe, USB, SATA, DDR, and LPDDR, etc.) is required
4. In-depth understanding of analog mixed-signal design, experience with high-speed serial and parallel circuits in advanced processes down to 3nm, FinFet, SOI, and bulk CMOS
5. Extensive experience using Cadence Virtuoso, Calibre, Hspice/Spectre, and static timing analysis tools (e.g., Nanotime)
6. Excellent ability to solve customer problems and deliver results in a timely manner
7. Experience in team building and project management
8. Strong organizational and communication skills where English is a must and Chinese is preferred

Job Description:
Position Overview:
The Manufacturing Executive will be responsible for overseeing the entire manufacturing process of Aprisium's IoT sensor analysers, from production planning and vendor management to quality control and compliance. You will ensure that all manufacturing activities are carried out efficiently, cost-effectively, and in line with Aprisium’s high-quality standards. This ideal candidate should have an understanding of manufacturing processes for complex devices involving fluidics, electrochemical sensors, and IoT technologies, as well as the capacity to manage the entire production lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:
Manufacturing Operations:
Develop and manage production schedules to meet demand forecasts, ensuring timely delivery while maintaining high quality. Coordinate with cross-functional teams (engineering, procurement, and supply chain) to ensure all materials are available for production.
Continuously analyze and improve manufacturing processes to enhance efficiency, reduce waste, and lower costs. Implement lean manufacturing principles and optimize production lines to eliminate bottlenecks.
Collaborate with R&D and engineering teams to transition new products from prototype to mass production. Ensure the successful integration of new product designs into the existing manufacturing process.
Work closely with the supply chain team to manage raw materials and component inventory, ensuring availability for uninterrupted production while minimizing excess stock.
Technical Responsibilities:
Oversee the manufacturing of Aprisium’s IoT-enabled, electrochemical sensor analyzers. Ensure that production processes comply with technical specifications and quality standards.
Implement and oversee quality control processes throughout production. Develop and maintain rigorous testing protocols to ensure that all products meet the required technical and performance standards.
Lead the troubleshooting of production issues, whether they are technical malfunctions, quality issues, or process inefficiencies. Work quickly to resolve issues and minimize production downtime.
Supplier & Vendor Management:
Develop and manage relationships with external vendors, suppliers, and manufacturing partners to ensure timely delivery of components and products. Negotiate contracts and ensure adherence to agreed-upon service-level agreements (SLAs).
Oversee outsourced manufacturing processes and ensure that external partners maintain quality and production efficiency standards. Visit partner facilities as needed to monitor progress and troubleshoot issues.
Compliance & Safety:
Ensure all manufacturing activities comply with local and international regulations, industry standards, and environmental laws. Maintain proper documentation for audits and certifications.
Promote a safe working environment by enforcing health and safety regulations in the production facility. Conduct regular safety checks and provide training to employees on best practices.
Cost Control & Financial Oversight:
Monitor and control production costs, ensuring that manufacturing processes remain within budget. Identify areas for cost savings without compromising on quality or efficiency.
Prepare regular reports on production costs, efficiency, and output. Work with the finance team to track manufacturing expenditures and optimize cost-effectiveness.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. Additional certifications in manufacturing processes (Lean, Six Sigma) are a plus.
Min. 4-6 years of experience in manufacturing, preferably in industries involving IoT devices, electrochemical sensors, or high-precision technology.
Hands-on experience in managing end-to-end production processes in a high-tech or electronics-focused environment.
Experience working in a startup or high-growth company is advantageous.
Deep understanding of production planning, process optimization, and quality control.
Proven ability to manage vendor relationships and work with outsourced manufacturing partners.
Proficiency in ERP/MRP systems and manufacturing software.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work cross-functionally across departments.
Personal Attributes:
A proactive, solution-oriented mindset with strong attention to detail.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to evolving needs.
Passion for environmental sustainability and the ability to align manufacturing practices with business and environmental goals.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and benefits package.
A dynamic and collaborative working environment with a focus on innovation.
Opportunities for career advancement in a purpose-driven company.
The chance to work on cutting-edge technology that positively impacts both business and the environment.

Job Description:
Moody's Analytics is a leading provider of risk and performance management software to the financial services industry.

We are seeking an experienced Solution Sales Executive to lead Enterprise Risk Management Software sales. The position is responsible for sales opportunity & territory management, sales strategy, and revenue generation related to the Moody’s Analytics suite of Credit Assessment and Origination and/or Regulatory Compliance and Capital Management solutions, including Regulatory Capital calculation, Regulatory Reporting, and software and services related to stress-testing.

This Sales Rep position requires expertise in managing complex, solution sales cycles, and involves working closely with pre-sales staff. Sales Reps manage and drive the sales process through the sales cycle. The position and territory is a blend of active account management and new account development.
Primary responsibility will be selling and maintaining new and existing client relationships through a strategic based approach in order to increase sales, and achieve set quarterly/yearly targets
Demonstrating the superiority and value of the Moody's Banking suite of solutions to potential and existing clients. This will often involve high quality presentations, client meetings and drafting proposals.
Manage and coordinate Moody's responses to requests for product and services information (RFIs and RFPs) from external parties, clients and prospects.
Must develop deep, practical understanding of Moody's Banking suite of solutions and services, with a focus on Regulatory Compliance, Capital Management and Lending solutions.
Must be able to identify/recognize cross-selling opportunities for Moody's by asking relevant questions to extrapolate the necessary information. This will also be achieved through working with account generalists.
Work closely in collaborating with teams to ensure high levels of client satisfactions in all client interaction including issue resolution.
Qualifications :
A bachelor degree is required. IT or business finance related discipline.
The successful candidate will have 5+ years of successful selling experience to financial institutions in ASEAN. Particular experience in selling to the Finance, Treasury or Risk Management groups within banks a plus.
Must have a basic IT and software implementation lifecycle understanding e.g. can fluently articulate topics around platforms, databases, solution deployment.
Must be a strong team player and able to work in a fast paced and diverse environment.
Good understanding of finance and risk management acquired either by advanced study or through industry experience a plus.
Experience with managing a pipeline and forecasting capabilities.
Estimated client travel 40-50%.

Job Description:
Our organization
Delaware Consulting Asia Pacific Pte Ltd (“delaware” in short) is an IT consulting company in Singapore with global connect. We deliver advanced ICT solutions and services, guiding our customers through their business and digital transformation. We partner with SAP, OpenText, and Microsoft, as well as a group of technology partners to support our customers with truly omni-channel customer experience.

Our Team
1. We are a dynamic, stimulating team of highly motivated professionals with attention for personal development in your expertise.
2. We offer a continuous process for learning, development, and growth.
3. We offer a challenging and dynamic job.
4. We know there’s more to life than work. We organize team events and impromptu drinks: Nothing better for team spirit, right?
5. We are a flat organization with short lines of communication.

Your Role
As an SAP MM Senior Consultant or Consultant, you are expected to demonstrate professional knowledge and behavior on assignments, taking care of customers and activities with important attention to the team aspect.

You are expected to work & deliver autonomously, coaching colleagues while working on customer and internal engagements.

You are required to provide enhancement implementation and support in the analysis, design, development, delivery, and maintenance of the MM modules of the SAP system, integrate and transform the processes with technology to help our clients achieve high performance.

Your Responsibilities
a. To provide guidance and solution expertise to support the functional and technical design/change by preparing the functional specifications, design and technical documents and/or change request documents for approval.
b. To provide solutions to the BUs and business requirements including effort estimation (configuration, workflow, interface, report, data mapping), change impact analysis and ensuring the technical integrity of the delivered solution.
c. To understand and study the user requirements, perform a feasibility study and propose sound solutions, and create functional specifications (business blueprints) and/or program specifications.
d. To perform system development work based on the specification. Conduct quality check, ABAP Code Review, quality testing and fulfil the tasks based on the specification before requesting for user acceptance test.
e. To prepare the functional, design and technical Specifications, conduct, UAT test cases, and cutover activities.
f. To troubleshoot system problems within MM/QM/WM and integration with other SAP modules or non-SAP systems, user operations support and ensure that user requirements are met.
g. To carry out the configuration of MM for the new setup. Work with a vendor or project manager on new integration with MM.
h. To facilitate and manage the integration of Ariba with SAP MM functions, and work with vendors to ensure compatibility and solution sustainability
i. To be involved in project implementation, to ensure the timeline for the project is being followed with no delay of assignment. In addition, you will be required to follow the SDLC documentation policy and will be involved in and responsible for all types of system documentation.
j. To manage system incident tickets/service requests to ensure SLA compliance and customer satisfaction. To carry out root-cause analysis, contribute to the knowledge base, and provide recommendations for continuous improvements to workflow, process, and technology.
k. To prepare knowledge transfer documents. Responsive attitude and Timely crisp status reporting.

About You
Your Knowledge, Skills and Qualification
a. You should possess a Degree in Computer Science/ Information Technology or any other tertiary or professional qualification.
b. Knowledge in integration with non-SAP systems using PI and experience in SAP UI5/Fiori will be an advantage.
c. Excellent logical & analytical skills with the ability to work independently.
d. Experience in preparation of Functional Specs, Design Specs, Technical Specs, UAT test cases, and cutover activities related to MM.
e. Experience in integrating Ariba with SAP MM functions, leveraging on CIG and other integration solutions.
f. Demonstrates Initiative, good working attitude and can work independently with minimum supervision and adhere to company policies.
g. Skillset in handling design of technical security including table, report, program, and interface security for the production environment.
h. Desirable to have a skillset in deploying solutions with SAP ERP using Ariba Cloud Integration.

Your Experience
a. Experience in implementing & supporting interfaces from/to non-SAP systems.
b. 3-5 years’ experience in SAP MM implementation for MM Consultant and 5-8 years’ experience for SAP MM Senior Consultant.
c. Experience in SAP ABAP, ODATA, FIORI & HANA, covering working experience in SAP modules like SD, MM, WM(LE) is advantageous.
d. Business and solution-oriented, with an industrial mindset with good planning and analytical skills.
e. Experience in interfaces with external systems, involving vendors. Clients and any other custom systems.

Job Title: Data Entry - Banking Operations (Corporate Account Svcs)
Job Description:
Work Hours: Mon - Fri, 9AM - 6:30PM or 10AM - 7:30PM.

Job Duties:

Banking Operations Maker roles of -
1. Setting up Internet Banking Facility
2. Setting up eServices related Facility
3. Maintenance of the internet banking and eServices facility
4. when required Ad-hoc duties as assigned

Comments:

1. A Maker creates banking transactions such as payments on behalf of their corporate clients through Bank Systems and for a transaction to be processed by the bank, the Authoriser needs to approve the transaction. What is Dual Approval? As the name implies, Dual Approval is a control that requires two separate people to authorize a transaction. The first person is responsible for creating the request (known as the maker), while the second person checks and approves the activity (known as the checker).

2. What will help you excel in this role:
- Time Management: High volume of transactions to be processed requires skilful time management to understand which tasks to prioritize.
- Attention to detail: As a maker, you will be required to be involved in data entry work which requires you to be meticulous.
- Adaptability: Dynamic & fast paced work environment which requires candidates to cope well under pressure.
- Good understanding of the banking function/operations flow: In order to perform well in this role, you will have to understand the nature of the operations flow/processes of the banking functions:
(A) Corporate Account Opening
(B) Corporate Account Maintenance
(C) eServices: Paylah QR Code, FAST Fund Transfer Set Up, Different Charges For Corporate Clients etc.
- Problem Solving/Areas Of Improvement: To find solutions to improve efficiency of the work processes/operations such as to improve turnover time.

Job Description:
Job Objectives

The specialized Group Application Support IT Production Support Engineer is responsible to support application wellness in production, investigate production issue raised, and respond to user with feasible workaround. Closely follow-up and monitor issue from investigation, pass relevant details to L2/L3 team. Clarify user queries. Make sure system availability as per SLA across countries for multiple applications / interfaces. Perform scheduled health check tasks across applications and raise alerts in case required.
Able to work in shift-based environment, support implementations during bank’s green zone.

Job Responsibilities

Investigate production issues, respond based on production defect severity SLAs.
Manage and respond to users on timely manner.
Log incident ticket for production issues and user queries
Follow up on defect and incident closure and meet incident closure KPI.
Make sure system availability as per respective agreed SLA.
Ensure daily start of day (SOD) and end of day (EOD) execution for supported applications complete successfully.
Provide support for annual Disaster Recovery (DR) exercise for supported applications.
Provide support to System Engineers on server level patches / upgrade as and when applicable.
Knowledge with 3rd party monitoring tools like Control-M, Genos, Splunk, SQL Monitor
Knowledge with Market Data, and Genos monitoring setup and dashboard configuration
Ensure application incident & task documentation is properly updated for each production release.
Enthusiastic, hardworking, proactive and goal-oriented, with excellent communication and presentation skills, demonstrated professionalism and attention to detail.
Proven ability to work and resolve production incidents under strict time constraints and provide workarounds using AS400/mainframe or Unix shell or DB scripts etc.
Strong skills in AS400, Linux/Unix Shell scripting, MS SQL, Oracle, BMC Control-M Scheduler
Good to have understanding and experience of ITIL methodology [service operation]


Requirements

Prior hand-on production support experience of OPEN Systems/AS4000
Good support knowledge in either one of the retail or wholesale payment or customer information systems
Willing to work in onsite shift-support model [24*7]
Hands-on experience in writing AS400 and SQL queries and parsing logs for issue investigation
Hands-on experience in writing shell scripts (UNIX) and optimize incidents investigation.
Strong written, oral communication skills and able to manage user.
Ability to easily adopt to any technology / environment.
2 or more years’ production support experience in bank or financial vendors across multiple technologies / platform
Be able to work in fast pace and high-pressure working environment.
Willingness to work across platforms – UNIX / open, AS/400 and mainframe


Possible Shift Patterns (Might be subjected to changes):

24/7:
1st shift - 7AM to 6PM
2nd shift - 11AM to 10PM
3rd shift - 9:30PM to 8AM
** this usually have 4 days/nights work followed by 3 days off

Regular:
1st shift - 8AM to 5:30PM
2nd shift - 9AM to 6:30PM
3rd shift - 1PM to 10PM
**this is usually Monday to Friday, weekends off

Job Description:
Job Objectives
IT Professional Services / Support for Network Engineering

Key Responsibilities
Provide onsite engineer for:
- Respond to network appliances connectivity issues and resolve any issues within the confines of the office.
- Collaborate with partners and service vendors to ensure that the proxy, firewalls, and network appliances stay operational.
- Responsible for configuration and maintaining Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Proxy/Web Isolation, Load-Balancer and Security Patches for equipment.
- Troubleshoot, provide resolution and raising tickets when networking equipment face issues.
- Create, maintain, and update documentation as it relates to configuration, process, and service records.
- Monitoring security measures for the protection of computer systems, networks, and information
- Responsible for providing customer support in solving all phases of complex information security related technical problems.
- Reviews and recommends information security solutions to customer problems based on an understanding of products/systems test results.

Key Requirements
- L2: 3 to 5 years’ experience in Network Infra Setup and Operations and at least 3 to 5 full delivery cycle implementations of relevant projects
- Required to work on wee hours, weekends, and public holidays.
- Knowledge of routing, switching, firewall, proxy/web isolation and data center operation.
- Able to work well in a team environment and use tools like Visio and Wireshark.

Job Title: Assembler, MNC | Gul Circle | 5 days (office hours) | Electrical
Job Description:
Job scope:
Assemble mechanical parts, pieces or products using a variety of tools and equipment according to the laid down specifications in the production line. Test/Calibrate the products as per the test specifications. Primary packing of the finished products. ERP system transactions of the production.
Read, interpret and follow assembly drawings, Product Test Specifications, Assembly Instruction Sheet, Six Sigma Sheets, Production Data sheet
Use of hand tools, power tools, and measuring devices such as tapes, Vernier caliper, pressure gauges, micrometers, GO/NOGO gauges, comparators etc.
Experience on the use of hand tools, power tools, and production equipment. Understanding of tightening techniques, Torque wrenches etc.
Use of Hand Pallet truck, Use of Semi Electric/Electric stacker
Understanding of 5s methodology
Understanding of defects, ppm (parts per million), DPMO (defects per million opportunities), CTQ (critical to quality), Basics of QC tools
Root Cause Analysis
Job requirement:
Diploma in electrical & eletronics engineering and relevant discipline
Ability to handle heavy jobs, products, raw material as per industrial safety norms
Regularly perform repetitive tasks

Job Description:
SAP Business One Consultant (Japanese Accounts)

As part of the SAP B1 Team, responsible for pre-sales activities, full cycle project implementation, as well as support and enhancement projects for Japanese customers.

Job Description:
Evaluate clients’ current business processes and make recommendations to resolve business problems
Conduct user requirement gathering and develop function design specifications in alignment with new business requirements
Perform system configuration and documentation, prepare unit testing script and carry out user-acceptance testing
Provide post-live support and conduct end-user training
Work closely with business users and ensure good rapport with clients

Job Requirements:
Degree in Information Technology/ Management, Computer Science, or Business (Accounting)
Minimum 2 years’ experience as SAP Business One Functional Consultant in a Consulting environment
Professionals with Accounting, IT, or other ERP solution experience who are keen on a career in SAP consulting may apply
Proven track record in at least 3 full-cycle project implementations for SAP Business One
Having good knowledge of SAP HANA will be an advantage
As the Consultant for Japanese customers and accounts, strong Japanese fluency in business and technical communications are essential
Skilled communicator with the ability to exchange complex information effectively with customers, analyse problems, and provide clear recommendations
Possesses excellent interpersonal skills with experience in managing multiple stakeholders and their priorities
Good team player, self-motivated, with a positive attitude

About Us / Company Overview:
We are an SAP Platinum Partner with HQ in Singapore and presence in Malaysia and Japan. Our customers range from Fortune 2000 customers to local SMEs, who we support with SAP S/4HANA, ByD, B1, and CX solutions.
We are growing our regional presence, and we are looking for passionate people to join us for various opportunities. For more information find us at www.axxis-consulting.com.

Why Join Us
If you want to accelerate your career growth, then you’ve come to the right place. We believe in stretching the envelope. We do not spoon-feed, we do not babysit, we do not micro-manage. What we do is to help people grow and develop their capabilities - fast.
International – We believe in diversity and a global workforce. We have customers all over the world, and work with various cultures.
Mutual Respect – We trust each other and our respective strengths and treat each other with respect.
Start-up Culture – You hate red tapes and bureaucracy – so do we. We just want to get the job done and focus on solving customer problems.
Adaptive and Flexible – We believe in change and flexibility to accommodate changing customer requirements and environments.

*Please note that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Job Description:
STT – Assistant Manager (GL)
As the Assistant Manager, Finance, you will be supporting the managed services function for Southeast Asia, specifically general ledger, management accounts and statutory reporting.

o Support financial reporting activities in accordance with the organisation's accounting policy and procedures and International Financial Reporting standards
o Preparation of monthly journals, monthly management accounts, including schedules reconciliation, variance analysis and cashflow forecasts.
o Preparation of documentations for treasury related transactions e.g. loans drawdown, covenants monitoring and reporting
o Manage and upkeep good internal controls relating to the integrity of data for financial reporting
o Ensure timely and accurate month end closing process, including Group submission
o Liaise with various stakeholders on necessary operational matters e.g. tax/treasury/operations
o Liaise and support audit requirements (internal/external audits/PCAOB etc)
o Support annual budget & forecast processes o Drive process improvement initiatives such as continual effort improvements in areas of accounting and reporting.
o Any other tasks as assigned.

Requirements
o Degree in Accounting, with Singapore Chartered Accountant Qualification
o At least 4-6 years of relevant working experience including 3-4 years at Big4 audit firm(s)
in automation and process
o Good knowledge in SAP S/4 Hana will be an advantage.
o Proficient in Microsoft Excel
o Meticulous and organized.
o Good communication skills and able to work independently

Job Description:
Role Summary
Join our dynamic web3 finance team as a Accountant and play a key role supporting our financial operations. You'll gain valuable experience in traditional accounting while diving into the exciting world of web3 and blockchain technology.


Main Responsibilities:
Assisting senior staff with core accounting tasks like audit schedules, budget, accounts payable/receivable, payroll, and financial reporting.
Performing reconciliation for expenses, revaluation, inter-co transactions and other related financial activities.
Performing administrative tasks, such as data entry, preparing invoices, processing claims and filing paperwork etc
Ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of financial records.
Contributing to the month-end close process and maintain strong internal controls.
Supporting audit, tax, financial planning and analysis, helping develop financial models and track variances to keep us on track.
Ensuring timely and accurate quarterly and yearly tax submission for GST and Corporate tax.
Requirements and Qualifications:
Strong organizational skills and a meticulous attention to detail for accurate financial recordkeeping.
Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Xero, ) and a willingness to learn new accounting-specific tools.
A keen interest in the web3 space and a desire to learn about cryptocurrency and blockchain technology.
Proactive and adaptable, with a can-do attitude to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Diploma / Degree in Accountancy
Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, in particular MS Excel.
Strong English written and verbal communication skills
Previous experience in finance or accounting is a plus, but recent graduates are also encouraged to apply.

Job Description:
Berries is THE home to a passionate and dynamic team of educators. Here we treasure learning, embrace change and constantly spur each other towards growth and excellence - doing it all in the spirit of fun and good cheer!
If you have a passion for the Chinese language, love nurturing the young, and enjoy learning and growing, join our Berries family to make a difference in the Chinese landscape of Singapore, one life at a time!

Chinese Language Teacher
Inspiring the child, lighting up the world!
Embracing our Company’s mission and values, you will integrate our teaching methodology in the delivery of effective Chinese lessons at Primary School level, inspiring children to learn Chinese in a fun way!
To excel in this position, you will need to: -
· have an accurate pronunciation for spoken Mandarin (in order to facilitate teaching in Chinese Language)
· possess experience in teaching local Primary School Chinese curriculum / Qualification in Chinese or Education studies
· display a warm and cheerful disposition
· work on weekends
Join us as a permanent staff to enjoy the following Employee Benefits
· Annual leave + Paid Berries Holiday Leave up to 20 days
· AWS +Variable Bonus
· Flexi Benefits (Outpatient, Specialist, Dental, Wellness, Optical, TCM etc)
· Weekend Incentive
· Comprehensive training provided
· Enrichment programmes for holistic personal development
· Excellent career opportunities
· Long service award
· School fees discount for staff children
We look forward to your application.
