Job Description:
JOB OVERVIEW
We are looking for an energetic and passionate individual to join Community Foundation of Singapore (CFS) as a Assistant Director, Charities & Grants Team. CFS is the only philanthropic foundation in Singapore that funds charity programmes across all causes. This provides opportunities to create impact across diverse needs in Singapore. Grant making in CFS is evolving towards becoming a catalyst for systemic change with a greater emphasis on sustainability and impact. We are looking for talents who can support CFS to drive the grantmaking strategies and operations and achieve greater efficiency, efficacy and impact.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Catalyse Grants
Develop innovative evidence based grantmaking strategies and practices and re-imagine how donations can create impact for charities
Oversee the development of grantmaking features for a new donor portal platform. Support the development of a new platform driven way to engage donors and charities and create novel online-offline experiences that enrich the donor’s philanthropic experience.
Generate significantly large value grants in partnership with donors and charity partners that improve impact delivery to the community
Impact Measurement
Develop and launch CFS Social Impact Framework that captures CFS’ direct and indirect contributions to our charity partners and beneficiaries
Operational Improvement
Streamline and enhance current grantmaking processes to improve productivity
Analyse grant making data to improve grant making and charity engagement strategies
Oversee knowledge and data management for the team with regular generation of reports on grantmaking trends, cause insights, donor demand.

COMPETENCIES
Basic degree in Social Sciences preferred;
At least 7 years of direct experience working in fundraising, managing grants or programmes in non-profit sector or public service sector
Core competencies in donor engagement, programme development, programme evaluation, and grant management.
Good interpersonal skills and strong proactive attitude.
Supportive team player and enjoys collaborating with others on projects
Meticulous eye for detail
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notifed.

Job Title: Senior Learning Strategist / Learning Strategist (Centre for Innovation in Learning) [NIE]
Job Description:
ABOUT THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF EDUCATION (NIE)
The National Institute of Education (NIE), Singapore, is Singapore’s national teacher education institute, and we are proud to be an integral part of the nation’s education service. We play a key role in the preparation of teachers and in the provision of teacher professional and school leadership development programmes. We are committed to our vision of being An Institute of Distinction: Leading the Future of Education, and our mission to Inspire Learning, Transform Teaching and Advance Research. Read more about NIE here.

We are seeking a pedagogically minded and dedicated Senior Learning Strategist / Learning Strategist. Reporting to the Learning Strategist Manager, the appointee collaborates with faculties to design and develop cutting-edge blended learning experiences, providing strategic guidance for implementing innovative digital teaching and learning practices across NIE.

Additionally, the appointee will work closely with fellow Learning Strategists and the other teams in the department to research, develop, and present innovative and pedagogically sound design solutions to stakeholders, in pursuit of enhanced practice and outcomes. The candidate should be familiar with the training and adult education landscape, be adept at facilitation and possess a commitment to staying up to date on higher education best practices. This is a 2-year contract position.

Responsibilities
Build Evidence-Based Innovation in Teaching & Learning within NIE
a) Collaborate with fellow Learning Strategists to:
Research adult learning theories, strategies, data, and appropriate educational technology tools to design, develop, and facilitate impactful face-to-face and online tech-enhanced workshops for faculty.
Assess the learning needs of IN-Learning specialists in learning design and emerging technology.
Design, develop, and facilitate engaging initiatives to support IN-Learning specialists in building their expertise in learning design and emerging technology.
b) Collaborate with NIE faculty to:
Identify learning needs for courses they teach.
Propose frameworks, new/enhanced learning outcomes, tech-enabled teaching and learning strategies, and assessments as part of course redesigning.
Propose appropriate educational technology to overcome gaps and enhance the learning outcomes of the courses.
Achieve constructive alignment of the learning outcomes with the learning activities and assessment in their courses.
c) Collaborate with cross-functional teams to:
Assess faculty capability development needs through qualitative and quantitative data analysis, to inform their work in designing, developing, and evaluating learner-centered blended learning experiences and fostering assessment literacy.
Research, develop and present evidence-based and innovative design solutions with the project team to stakeholders.
Research and evaluate frameworks and educational technology tools for implementation to optimize and innovate teaching, learning and assessment practices in NIE.
Research, write grant proposals and develop tech-enabled learning solutions.
Work together on initiatives with IN-Learning's Engagement, Planning and Research team to share learning sciences knowledge and improve practices institute-wide.
Carry out action research by:
conceptualizing frameworks and methodologies
designing evaluation instruments
gathering and analyzing data (e.g. Learning Analytics)
formulating decisions to improve the effectiveness of learning experiences and our Capability Development initiatives
Contribute to special projects on teaching and learning, as required.

Keep Up with Learning Sciences and Innovative Teaching and Learning Practices
Stay current on learning sciences, innovative teaching and learning practices in higher education (e.g., personalized learning, adaptive learning, e-assessment, hybrid learning, learning analytics, and Artificial Intelligence).
Foster a culture of continuous learning within the team by providing opportunities for professional development and encouraging knowledge sharing.

Requirements
A University degree, preferably in Instructional Design, Education or Learning Sciences and Technologies. A master’s degree is preferred.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in instructional design, teaching and learning, within a higher educational setting or with adult learners. Proven ability to manage successful learning projects.
To be considered for the Senior Learning Strategist position, candidates should:
Possess at least 5 years of experience in instructional design, teaching, learning, and the adult education landscape.
Possess a proven track record of managing complex learning projects.
Demonstrate experience in a mentorship role and in leading complex projects.
Expert knowledge of applying Adult Learning theories in the design of Blended Learning experiences.
Possess strong research skills.
Proven track record in designing and facilitating faculty development workshops for diverse audiences.
Possess strong written, verbal, and presentation skills.
Strong knowledge of emerging educational technologies for teaching and learning.
Excellent time management skills to meet multiple deadlines simultaneously and consistently deliver high-quality results.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Experience in facilitating both face-to-face and online sessions.
Familiarity with Learning Management System and a demonstrated ability to rapidly learn new tools and processes with minimal support.
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and strong problem-solving abilities.
Highly motivated, able to work independently yet also a strong team player.
A strong desire to learn, acquire, and share new knowledge.
Maintain a positive attitude and work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities & Learning Outcomes:
Talent Acquisition Support: Assist in sourcing, screening, and coordinating interviews for potential candidates through various channels.
Candidate Relationship Management: Serve as a point of contact for candidates, ensuring a smooth and positive experience throughout the recruitment process.
Recruitment Strategy Assistance: Contribute to the development and implementation of recruitment strategies to attract top-tier talent.
Process Optimization: Streamline recruitment processes and enhance efficiency.
Market Research and Analysis: Conduct research on industry trends and competitor strategies to inform recruitment initiatives.
Employer Branding Support: Assist in the creation of recruitment marketing materials and employer branding activities.
Event Coordination: Support the organization and execution of recruitment events, job fairs, and campus recruitment activities.
Sales Development Assistance: Assist in identifying potential clients and opportunities, conducting market research, and supporting sales initiatives.
Data Management: Maintain accurate records of candidate interactions, recruitment metrics, and sales activities for analysis and reporting purposes.
Administrative Assistance: Provide administrative support to the business development team as required.

Qualifications & Experience:

Candidates should be aspiring and hungry individuals who desire to produce exemplary performance with the highest standards of ethics, reliability, independence, and productivity. Other requirements include:
Singaporeans / Permanent Residents only.
Minimally full certificate in GCE'A' Level, International Baccalaureate Diploma qualification, Diploma awarded by a polytechnic in Singapore or equivalent.
Undergrads are welcomed.
Proficiency in interpersonal communication and cultivating positive relationships is a fundamental requirement.
Demonstrating genuine enthusiasm and a strong interest in investment and financial concepts is highly valued.
Prior knowledge in banking or the financial sector is advantageous.
Candidates with no prior experience are encouraged to apply, as comprehensive training will be provided.
Recommended Minimum Age of 21 Years Old. Based on MAS (Monetary Authority of Singapore) regulatory requirement.
We are also open to individuals seeking a mid-career switch or looking to pivot out of their current roles into sectors such as Finance, Human Resource, and Marketing.
Whether you are seeking to enhance your skills or make a significant career change, our comprehensive training programs and supportive mentorship will equip you with the knowledge and experience needed to succeed in your new field. You will gain valuable insights and practical skills that will enable you to confidently transition into your desired career path.


Benefits:

Boost your portfolio to enhance your future employability.
Improve on your professional social media skills and outreach.
Key insights into the financial services sector.
Potential conversion to full time roles are possible depending on your work ethic and performance.

Job Description:
The National Institute of Education invites suitable applications for the position of Research Assistant on a 11-month contract at the Learning Sciences & Assessment Department.

Project Title: Examining the emotional regulation for feedback receptivity in Singapore Secondary Schools: An instrument development and validation study

Project Introduction: The project focuses on understanding how secondary school students in Singapore manage their emotions during feedback situations. Through face-to-face interview and focus group discussion with teachers and students using the Emotional Regulation Situational Judgement Test (SJT), the project aims to enhance student holistic learning and well-being.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in education, psychology or related disciplines.
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
Good organizational skills.
Keen attention to detail.
Able to work independently and in a team environment.
Good knowledge of qualitative research design.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications and experience using NVivo is strongly preferred, but not required.
Experience working in a research or school environment preferred, but not required.
Responsibilities:
Duties would include but not limited to the following:
Contacting schools to coordinate research.
Organizing meetings.
Taking meeting minutes.
Data collection, entry, coding and analysis.
Conducting literature reviews.
Reporting writing.
Other duties as assigned by the Principal Investigator (PI).
Application
Applicants (external and internal) will apply via Workday. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Closing Date
Closing date for advertisements will be set to 14 calendar days from date of posting.

Job Title: Research Officer (Antimicrobial Chemical Biology Lab), A*STAR ID Labs
Job Description:
A*STAR Infectious Diseases Labs (A*STAR ID Labs) is seeking for a Research Officer to join us in our mission to be a leading centre of infectious diseases research. A*STAR ID Labs aims to develop a cohesive A*STAR response to drive and deliver translational infectious diseases research to better health and economic outcomes.
The candidate will be joining the Antimicrobial Chemical Biology Lab, a newly established group in A*STAR ID Labs focusing on the development of synthetic antimicrobial compounds for potential therapeutic applications. Scholarship opportunities will be available for those interested in pursuing further education at the master’s or PhD level.
Research projects will encompass various tasks such as:
Chemical synthesis
In vitro activity testing
Understanding mechanisms of action
In vivo efficacy evaluation.
Support the team in lab operation
Upkeep of consumables
Safety oversight
Labware procurement
Documenting experimental procedures and results.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in microbiology, biomedical science, chemistry, chemical engineering, bioengineering, or related field
Familiarity with basic microbiology (e.g., bacteria/fungi culture, agar plating, PCR) and chemistry (e.g., reaction setup, column purification, HPLC) lab techniques, programming, and/or common graphics software (e.g., Photoshop) will be advantageous.
Highly motivated and passionate about scientific research
Good spoken and written communication skills
Team player
Receptive and detail-orientated
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
The School of Physical and Mathematical Sciences (SPMS) of NTU is an exciting environment for research. The Yong research group works on novel problems in biological and complex systems and has published many high impact papers in top scientific journals such as Science, PNAS, Phys. Rev. Lett., etc.
Our approach is highly interdisciplinary, using emerging state-of-the-art methods from mathematics, physics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, topological data analysis, and statistics. We are interested in analyzing big data of complex systems such as DNA, RNA, biological networks, social networks, financial markets, etc., in order to understand their behavior, pattern and interaction.
Understanding the structure-function relationships of biomolecules is an active area of research due to its fundamental importance in biology, physics, and engineering. The emerging field of Mathematical AI for Molecular Sciences is proposed for molecular representation, featurization, and learning. We are interested in developing physical models using graphs, simplicial complexes for molecular representation, featurization, and learning, particularly in the context of nucleic acids such as DNA, G-quadruplex. The results from the research will provide key insights to understanding the structure-function relationships of biomolecules.
The Yong research group is looking for a highly motivated and qualified Research Fellow with the ambition of producing high quality research that can be published in high impact journals. The Research Fellow will be involved in research design, data analysis, model development, numerical simulations, and report/paper writing.
The Research Fellow is expected to perform state of the art numerical simulations using computing resources from National Supercomputing Centre (NSCC) Singapore. The incumbent has freedom to design the nature and type of deep learning simulations.
Key Responsibilities:
Utilize recently developed mathematical tools from algebraic topology, combinatorial topology, computational topology, and differential geometry (e.g., Betti numbers, Hodge-Laplacian, discrete Ricci curvature) to characterize and model biopolymers such as DNA and RNA.
Develop simplicial models for molecular representation, featurization, and learning, particularly in the context of nucleic acids such as DNA, G-quadruple, to better understand form-function relationship in biology.
Use molecular modeling and AI (using e.g., the SMILES protocol) to quickly and accurately assess compounds with Essential Physicochemical Properties for drug design and development.
Translate research findings into practical applications in pharmacology.
Perform numerical simulations on National Supercomputing Centre (NSCC) Singapore.
Job Requirements:
PhD from a reputable university, preferably in physical sciences or STEM related field.
Good publication track record.
Strong background in artificial intelligence and biochemistry with prior experience in numerical simulations.
Expertise in numerical simulations, and the ability to code and run simulations on deep learning workstation/supercomputers clusters.
Able to think and work independently and have the aspiration to perform high quality research that can be published in high impact journals
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
Who we are:
minden.ai is a technology venture founded by Temasek in strategic partnership with DFI Retail Group and coalition partners BreadTalk Group, DBS Bank, PAssion Card, Mandai Wildlife Group, Singtel, FoodPanda, GoJek and Great Eastern. We are on a mission to redefine the engagement between brands and consumers in Southeast Asia.

The way we work:
At Minden, we treat each other with respect. We embrace authenticity and transparency. We pride ourselves on agility and innovation, and believe in embracing continuous learning and self-improvement. We strive to be the preferred employer by providing comprehensive benefits, a dynamic and exciting working environment, work-life balance and effort recognition.
We are seeking for individuals with grit and passion, an insatiable intellectual curiosity and a heart for people to amplify effectiveness as a team.

As a Machine Learning Lead, you will:
Lead, coach and mentor a high-performing Machine Learning team.
Guide our ML architecture to ensure performance, security, and extensibility.
Collaborate with the leadership team to develop the company's roadmap for AI/ML.
Work closely with the product team to design and deliver a ML-based pricing system that delights our customers with a hyper-personalised experience.
Work cross functionally to operationalise machine learning models and serve inferences efficiently, which include automating data pipelines, machine learning pipelines, performance monitoring and testing.
Be the evangelist for AI/ML through mentoring and technical/knowledge sharing.
What you should have:
A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, IT or a related discipline.
Possess at least 8 years of experience in software engineering, data engineering and ML engineering. Minimal 3 years experience in leading a ML team.
Experience in creating, managing and coaching high performing engineering teams and being technically hands-on as a leader.
Programming experience in Python, Java, Pyspark and Scala.
Possess knowledge of Big Data frameworks like Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, etc
Experience in building and optimizing Machine Learning models, ML pipelines, data pipelines and architectures.
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch.
Experience working in an agile startup environment

Job Description:
Responsibilities:

Performing all Credit Administration related function pertaining to Syndicated / Bilateral loans excluding retail personal segment loan and trade finance advances of non-credit customers.
Monitoring of the asset quality of all Corporate accounts. Analysis of alerts flagged in FACTIVA or any other source and note with your specific views and the impact on the credit quality of the loan
Analysis of the stock market filings for listed borrowers’ and its impact on our credit quality
Analysis of the stock / bond market performance for listed borrowers on weekly/monthly/quarterly/HY/Yearly intervals. Details of the same along with analysis of Axe sheet at same intervals of other banks on our borrowers will be put up.
Analysis of quarterly results/annual reports for borrower accounts and variations with the risks / risk mitigation’s captured in the sanction proposal. Monthly performance of stock/bond market of the borrower corporates to be commented.
Analyse and furnish month on month movement of prices in AXE sheet for our borrower accounts. Coordinate with other FIs Sales team for AXE sheets.
To have a concall with the borrower/ facility agent / Home branch/ Nodal branch etc to understand the performance of the company / account.
Analyse the share holding pattern of the Borrower Company/ change of directors/ Removal /appoint of new directors to be put up on monthly basis.
To ensure compliance of Loan Grading and provisioning as per MAS 612 notice/ RBI guidelines, whichever is more stringent.
Monitoring of Early Warning Signal (EWS) and escalation as per SOP along with specific inputs
Periodic review of loan grading through quarterly borrower wise tracker and on account of delay in receipt of compliance certificate beyond the threshold period.
Follow up with the borrower/ Agent for regularisation of irregular loans.
Unit visits as per terms of sanction.
Follow up of NPA and Advances under Collection Account (AUCA) and accounts removed from AUCA
Checking of all function in Finacle including opening of account, disbursement, repayment, interest feeding, interest Checking of Daily Finacle reports like Finacle Loan diary, Limit excess report related to Corporate Credit Monitoring.
Completion of Documentation process for allotted Credit Accounts based on the term sheet/facility letter prepared by the Credit & Syndication Dept and in co-ordination with legal counsel, creation of Document files and safe custody of the same.
Recovery of processing fee/ other charges for various Credit Administration functions.
To ensure compliance of Condition Precedent (CP) before disbursement. Follow up for compliance of other Condition subsequent (CS) as per terms of sanction/Facility Agreement and perfection of security.
Coordination with Treasury Team for arranging funding for the scheduled disbursement.
Authorization of Roll overs of Loans in Finacle.
Application of proper interest rates as per the sanction terms
Verification/Authorization financial payment messages) and non-financial messages through Finacle.
Checking of follow-up messages, roll over notices, interest advice to borrowers and other lenders/participating branches.
Checking of notice/advices to borrower for payments.
Correspondence with borrowers/agents through email or phone calls for their confirmation on payment due or on clarification of various issues relating to different clauses of facility agreement, interest periods, compliance certificate etc.
Verify the funds positioning sheet prepared by Executive ( Credit Admin)
Maintenance/ safe custody of Credit file/ loan documents/ title deeds etc., / security documents.
Facility Agency and Nodal Agent functions of advising loan drawdowns and other credit operations viz sharing of loan documents, approvals, obtention of information from the borrower and miscellaneous approvals from other lenders.
Checking and verifying the input sheet and verification of transactions in Finacle.
Liaising with the other lenders/branches regarding their payment instruction & confirmation, interest rate and compliance of Condition Subsequent if any.
Preparation of regulatory returns (MAS, RBI) at stipulated intervals. Maker and Checker mechanism is put in place for verification.
Preparation of various IBG returns and internal reports (including Adhoc and Miscellaneous reports for internal meetings and top management)
Attending to Internal and External Audits including credit audit, statutory audit, internal audit related to Corporate loan accounts and ensure rectification of deficiencies pointed out. Addressing any loan related queries from regulators.
Follow-up for submission of periodic financials and compliance certificates including testing of laid down covenants
Attending to review of Credit admin department SOP, manuals, policies and other activities as per laid down frequency. Review of list of empanelled lawyers and valuers at laid down frequency.
Submission of Quarterly, half yearly and Annual returns to IBG and Local Regulator.
Checking of CISLA, CCDP report and MIS sites on ongoing basis so as to ensure sanctity of data.
Working out quarterly ECL provision figures in the ECL model as per the methodology/SOP document.
Compliance to various action points emerged in committee and Review meetings related to Credit Administration within timelines
Requirements:

Degree or equivalent, preference will be given to those who hold master’s degree in the field of Banking/ finance and have done courses related to Banking
Banking experience of minimum 10 continuous years, out of which minimum 05 years of experience in a bank in Credit Management.
Very good understanding of financial statements.
Sound knowledge of banking systems/processes/procedures.
Good management skills and analytical mindset, one who can effectively analyse a situation and make decisions to address issues/problem.
Excellent communication and inter personal skills with the ability to Interact with all levels of staff and top management

Job Description:
Our client is actively searching for a Senior Asst Director, Stewardship to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

Reporting into the Director, Stewardship, the (Senior) Assistant Director of Gift Stewardship and Reporting plays a pivotal role in managing the stewardship and reporting functions for major donors at the University.
This role involves developing and executing strategies for donor engagement and ensuring effective fund utilization, by collaborating with faculties to align donor contributions with institutional needs, and ensuring the administration of funds to ensure they meet donor intentions and organizational priorities. The role is also responsible for preparing comprehensive impact reports, maintaining accurate donor data, and working closely with leadership to align stewardship initiatives with the University's strategic goals, ultimately enhancing the university's ability to engage donors and maximize the impact of their support.

The responsibilities of this role are:
Stewardship and Donor Engagement: Develop and implement strategic plans to recognize and engage major donors. This involves creating tailored recognition programs, managing personalized communications, and fostering strong donor relationships to enhance engagement and retention.
Faculty Engagement: Collaborate with faculty members to ensure that donor funds are utilized effectively. Align donor contributions with faculty needs and projects, and facilitate communication between faculty and donors to demonstrate the impact of their support.
Donor Fund Utilization: Work with Faculties to ensure the allocation and administration of donor funds are used according to donor intentions and organizational priorities. Monitor the effectiveness of fund utilization and provide transparent reporting on fund impacts.
Impact Reporting: Supervise the preparation and delivery of detailed impact reports for major donors. Ensure reports accurately reflect the outcomes and achievements resulting from their contributions, and maintain high standards of reporting accuracy and integrity.
Data Management: Ensure the accuracy and confidentiality of donor records within the CRM system. Track and analyze donor engagement data to inform strategic decisions and maintain compliance with reporting standards.
Strategic Alignment: Work closely with leadership to align stewardship initiatives with the University’s strategic goals. Contribute to long-term planning and goal-setting to support the university’s growth and success.
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
A Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline
Understanding of philanthropy as it relates to higher education.
Knowledge of good donor relationship management
Minimum of 10 - 12 years’ experience preferably in higher education (or a comparably complex organization) in development, stewardship, advancement, or a related function, involving a range of senior stakeholders.
Demonstrated success in achieving strategic outcomes in a large and complex environment.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate to a wide range of audiences with gravitas.
Excellent ability to innovate and deal with ambiguity and organizational sensitivity with tact and diplomacy; to be opportunistic, responsive, resourceful, and resilient.
Demonstrate a clear understanding and awareness of ethical considerations pertaining to advancement work, as well as an understanding and appreciation of cultural and intercultural sensitivities.
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Senior Engineer / Engineer (Thin Film - CVD Equipment)
Job Description:
Job Description:
To own, maintain and improve the following indices: Quality, Uptime and Cost.
Sustain equipment KPI and make continuous improvements to enhance the performance.
Monitor and control equipment performance indices. Optimize PM procedures to make it more effective and efficient.
Coordinate with both process and Manufacturing Engineers to ensure work is carried out efficiently to meet module objectives.
Manage the logistics for parts so as to prevent prolonged uptime losses in the case of equipment failure.
Manage the expenditure allocated for equipment maintenance without compromising on quality output.
Continuous improvement of equipment KPI in terms of quality, uptime and costs.
Plan and implement an effective Preventive Maintenance program on equipment.
Coach and Mentor subordinates to ensure that skill level and knowledge are up to date, and continuously give feedback on their work performance.
Document Corrective Action and Best Known Methods, and Fan it out to all for maximum ROI and learning.
Participate in CIP programs to optimize equipment utilization and cost of maintenance.
Become the technical Expert for the respective machine specialization.
Know how to use SPACE to monitor and analyze SPC charts. Know how to use JMP to analyze engineering
experiments. Know how to use measurement instruments effectively in data collection.
Understand FMEA and be able to generate FMEA analysis for new tool. Able to utilize it to identify tool
weaknesses and derive the top 3 to 5 risk factors.
Able to create PROMIS (SiView) DC OP and SPC charts.
Coordinate new equipment start-up to support production, from facilities hookup, vendor startup, to acceptance of
equipment for production.
Wafer scrap reduction awareness and mindset.
Follow up on SPSR, MRB, 8D, TECN, and ECN documentation for closure of issues / events. Provide guidance
to Junior Engineers.
Self audit and update specifications to meet TS16949 Quality Standard requirements.
Set Expectation and carry out performance appraisal for Technician or AE as instructed by
Section Manager.

Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Mechanical / Mechatronics / Microelectronics Engineering
Min 3 years of relevant work experience in Thin Film CVD Equipment
An excellent team player with good interpersonal, communication and written skills
Strong logical thinking capability and good analytical skill
High level of integrity with strong leadership attributes to lead and coach a team
Highly committed with good ownership and accountability
Able to adapt in a fast pace environment and work under pressure
Proficient in MS Office Applications

Job Overview
The SEA O2O (Online-to-Offline) Manager will be responsible for managing all O2O business activities for Organisation SEA across Southeast Asia, including but not limited to delivery operations. This role involves integrating online and offline customer experiences, optimizing delivery processes, and enhancing the overall O2O strategy. The ideal candidate will ensure seamless interactions between digital platforms and physical stores to drive customer satisfaction and business growth.
Key Responsibilities
O2O Strategy: Develop and implement comprehensive O2O strategies to integrate online and offline customer experiences.

Job Title: Research Officer, Laboratory of Computational Transcriptomics (GIS)
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Research Officer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing and optimizing algorithms for the generation of synthetic RNAs. This role involves a strong emphasis on computational biology, algorithm development, and the application of machine learning techniques to simulate RNA sequences and structures.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and optimize algorithms for generating synthetic RNA sequences with specific properties.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate these algorithms into our synthetic biology platform.
Analyze large datasets to validate the accuracy and efficiency of generated synthetic RNAs.
Work closely with experimental biologists to design in silico RNA sequences that can be tested in the lab.
Contribute to the development of software tools that assist in the design and simulation of synthetic RNAs.
Stay updated with the latest research and technological advancements in the field of RNA biology and synthetic biology.
Document research findings and present them at internal meetings and external conferences.
Requirements:
A Master or Bachelor degree in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Synthetic Biology, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or C++.
Experience with RNA sequence analysis, algorithm development, or machine learning is preferred.
Familiarity with RNA secondary structure prediction and synthetic biology principles is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a multidisciplinary research environment.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
The Hwei-Ee Tan lab studies the fundamental biological basis of “gut-feelings”, how bacteria in the gut signals to the host to influence physiology and behaviour. Using mice as a mammalian model, the lab investigates how diet and microbiome factors modulates host phenotypes (e.g. food reward, anxiety behaviours, etc). Besides supporting curiosity-driven basic research on the gut-brain axis, his lab is also studying the brain-gut axis, to uncover host-microbe interactions. His lab’s work is multidisciplinary, the research scope covers diverse skills from molecular biology to systems neuroscience, physiology and behaviour. With top-tier research support from National Research Foundation Singapore, Brain & Behavior Research Foundation (NARSAD), etc, his lab at NTU LKCMedicine is actively recruiting talented postdoctoral research fellows, research assistants, and interns, and also open to sponsoring motivated PhD/Masters students. A short-term or part-time research assistantship may also be arranged for motivated trainees. Applicants are strongly encouraged to look up the lab’s website and email the PI with a cover letter and a CV/resume.

Key Responsibilities:
The applicant must be exceptionally self-motivated, a team player, willing to assist with essential lab duties and learn new skills, and is expected to have relevant experience in one or more of these areas (e.g. mice/rodent handling, optogenetics and behaviours, animal surgery and dissection, calcium imaging, gnotobiotic studies and microbiome analysis, etc).
The research assistant will learn and assist with a range of work, including but not limited to molecular biology and histology procedures, microscopy, rodent behavioural assays, neuroscience optogenetic and chemogenetic techniques, functional recording and calcium imaging, mice surgery, data analysis and presentation, lab maintenance and office/administrative help.
Key Competencies / Requirements:
Hold Master's degree in Biology or relevant disciplines
Have a keen interest in the lab’s research theme on the microbiome gut brain neuroscience
Be proficient in relevant techniques described above
Be highly motivated and conscientious
Work independently, and also have the ability to work effectively in a team
Have good organisational, verbal and interpersonal skills

Job Description:
The Hwei-Ee Tan lab studies the fundamental biological basis of “gut-feelings”, how bacteria in the gut signals to the host to influence physiology and behaviour. Using mice as a mammalian model, the lab investigates how diet and microbiome factors modulates host phenotypes (e.g. food reward, anxiety behaviours, etc). Besides supporting curiosity-driven basic research on the gut-brain axis, his lab is also studying the brain-gut axis, to uncover host-microbe interactions. His lab’s work is multidisciplinary, the research scope covers diverse skills from molecular biology to systems neuroscience, physiology and behaviour. With top-tier research support from National Research Foundation Singapore, Brain & Behavior Research Foundation (NARSAD), etc, his lab at NTU LKCMedicine is actively recruiting talented postdoctoral research fellows, research assistants, and interns, and also open to sponsoring motivated PhD/Masters students. A short-term or part-time research assistantship may also be arranged for motivated trainees. Applicants are strongly encouraged to look up the lab’s website and email the PI with a cover letter and a CV/resume.

Key Responsibilities:
The applicant must be exceptionally self-motivated, a team player, willing to assist with essential lab duties and learn new skills, and is expected to have relevant experience in one or more of these areas (e.g. mice/rodent handling, optogenetics and behaviours, animal surgery and dissection, calcium imaging, gnotobiotic studies and microbiome analysis, etc).
The research assistant will learn and assist with a range of work, including but not limited to molecular biology and histology procedures, microscopy, rodent behavioural assays, neuroscience optogenetic and chemogenetic techniques, functional recording and calcium imaging, mice surgery, data analysis and presentation, lab maintenance and office/administrative help.
Key Competencies / Requirements:
Hold a Diploma or Bachelor degree in Biology or relevant disciplines
Have a keen interest in the lab’s research theme on the microbiome gut brain neuroscience
Be proficient in relevant techniques described above
Be highly motivated and conscientious
Work independently, and also have the ability to work effectively in a team
Have good organisational, verbal and interpersonal skills

Job Description:
We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence. As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

About the role :
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to lead our operational excellence and change management activities in Energy Systems Region Asia Pacific. This is a newly established role in the region. You will report to the Regional Finance and Performance Manager, with a dotted line to the Global Operational Excellence Lead, while working closely with the Regional Leadership Team and the global network of Operational Excellence Managers.
As part of the global operational excellence team, the Operational Excellence Manager will drive step-change improvements in operational performance, delivering greater value to customers, employees, DNV Energy Systems, and society. This will be done by developing and leveraging our Lean Operational Excellence methodology, empowering teams, and leading key improvement initiatives to achieve measurable benefits.

Key responsibilities:
Collaborate with the Global Operational Excellence Lead to identify, prioritize, and launch improvement pilots across the region

Collaborate closely with a global team of Operational Excellence Managers and share lessons learned
Lead and proactively drive Operational Excellence and Change Management initiatives
Assist in designing, refining and tailoring Lean Operational Excellence, Performance Management, and Change Management concepts
Develop Lean Operational Excellence learning paths and deliver training (both in-person and virtually)
Occasional travel may be required

Treatment, Annual Medical Examination, Hospitalization & Surgical Benefits)

Company bonus/Profit share
*Benefits may vary based on position, tenure/contract/grade level*
DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this.

Job Title: Research Engineer / Senior Research Engineer (Trust Technologies)
Job Description:
Nanyang Technological University’s Mastercard-NTU Joint Lab was established to advance digital trust and cybersecurity. Leveraging Mastercard's industry expertise and NTU's educational resources, the lab leads research and training programs to enhance cybersecurity infrastructure and foster digital trust.

We are looking for a Senior / Research Engineer to design, develop, implement, and oversee techniques and systems in Trust Technology and related areas such as privacy and security, blockchain, and Web 3.0 which are important components of digital trust platforms. The role will focus on emerging technologies that engender trust and espouse the values of fairness, safety, and privacy in digital technologies.

Key Responsibilities:
Conduct research into trust technologies testing – translating research algorithms, and design/develop tools and frameworks into working prototypes that can explain how research outputs can be productised into new capabilities.
Work closely with Centre’s researchers to design and develop system implementation work from research into product.
Design and build working tools that can support technology transfer of new research capabilities to practical solution capabilities that can be used to showcase the value of a given research outcome.
Write and maintain technical documentation, presentations, and papers on research into trust technologies testing, help to educate and raise the overall competency of Singapore manpower in emerging areas of trust technologies.
Engage global partners and researchers to understand latest trends and advance Singapore’s mindshare in this domain.
For research engineer position, the emphasis is on the engineering and implementation of trust technologies
For senior research engineer position, the emphasis is on the system and architecture design of trust solutions for digital transformation in addition to their engineering and implementation.
Job Requirements:
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in computer science/ engineering or related fields.
Proficiency in programming languages Java, C/C++ is a must. Experience in other programming languages and/or frameworks such as Python, Go, Spring will be an advantage.
Proficiency with working with common Linux distributions such as Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL etc. (including shell scripting) is a must.
Proficiency and experience in developing network and communication protocols and using socket programming in cloud-based systems is a must.
Proficiency in installing, configuring and using SQL database is a must. Experience in other data processing technologies such as NoSQL, Hadoop is an advantage.
Proficiency and experience in working with different virtualization technologies to enhance cloud service system performance is a must.
Experience in developing AI/ML systems from end to end, including data exploration, feature engineering, model training/evaluation is an advantage.
For senior research engineer position, knowledge in privacy enhanced technologies, Web 3.0, and advanced data analytics skill are advantageous.
Ability to code-switch effortlessly between talking business and talking tech, and can help stakeholders, engineers, and businesses easily understand difficult research tech concepts
Ability to work independently and to develop solutions under strict timelines is a must.
Good knowledge of middleware technologies, API development, related system frameworks and service stacks.
Familiarity with general API security concepts (such as key validation, authentication, authorisation).
Good understanding of relational database and Unix shell scripting skills.
For senior research engineer position, experience in designing and architecting system solutions related to trust technologies.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
The position of the Head of Culinary for The American Club (hereinafter referred to as TAC) is to oversee and direct the culinary and hygiene operations in TAC, aimed at driving optimal operational performance in Food & Beverage while ensuring that financial objectives are being achieved. As the Head of Culinary, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standard:

Culinary Operations Management
Drive overall outlets profitability.
Ensure all Culinary processes comply with government regulated standards.
Lead the internal auditor inspection of all outlets and ensure compliance with HACCP policies.
Manage food quality and costs with within budget guidelines.
Conduct training session for culinary team members to enhance their skills and knowledge on the menu.
Ensure that SOPs are developed and put in place for all culinary operations.
Ensure quality food products are produced in line with goals designated by Management.
Direct menu creation and implementation on a timely basis that is appropriate and responsive to the market needs.
Monitor the quality of raw and cooked food to ensure that standards are met.
Create Unique Selling Points (USP) for each of the varied outlets in the Club.
Conduct food tasting regularly to ensure production of quality food products.
Oversee annual budgets and review sales and food costs to achieve budget goals.
Monitor operational trend and optimize plan to schedule purchase and requisition of raw materials.
Implement guidelines and control procedures for procurement and receiving areas.
Maintain good knowledge of industry trends and changes.
Ensure non-standard culinary requests are met, in particular, due to special dietary needs of guests.
Work with facilities management to ensure adequate preventive maintenance programs are being put in place to keep kitchen equipment in good working condition and maximizing their lifespan.
Resolve guests feedback in a prompt, courteous and professional manner with proper documentation and resolutions.
Ensure collaboration and rapport is maintained with all external parties
Ensure overall efficiency in food production and general cleaning of kitchens, equipment and utensils.
Workplace Safety, Hygiene and Sanitization Management
Oversee hygiene team to ensure hygiene guidelines are strictly adhered to, by providing training on hygiene standards and performing regular inspections.
Oversee stewarding team to provide equipment checks, update cleaning schedules and project status while ensuring that health, safety and sanitization regulations are being complied with.
Ensure compliance of local regulations pertaining to food and refuse transportation around kitchens and service corridors.
Chair Workplace Safety Committee for Food & Beverage and ensure that workplace safety policies are strictly adhered to.
Requirements
Degree / Diploma / Certification in Culinary or Management
Preferably with minimum 10 years of experience in managing 5-star hotels / resorts and involved in huge culinary operations (catering to more than 500 pax) in the United States of America.
Possess comprehensive and diverse culinary background to cope with large diverse Food & Beverage set-up.
Knowledge of Asian and Western cuisines with dynamic understanding of latest culinary concepts.
Possess financial acumen in managing food cost as well as planning for full year forecast and budget.

Job Description:
Established in 1973, the American Chamber of Commerce in Singapore (AmCham Singapore) is the largest and the most active international business association in Singapore and Southeast Asia, with over 6,000 business leaders representing 650 member companies.

Our Chamber comprises 12 industry-specific committees: five sectoral and seven functional. AmCham is a forward-thinking, business-progressive association. Our mission is to create value for our members by providing advocacy, business insights, and connections. Our membership includes American companies and Singaporean and third-country companies with significant U.S. business interests.

AmCham is an independent, non-partisan business organization. Our goal is to provide the information and facilitate the access and connections that give members insight into the local, regional, and global operating environment, enhance their professional capabilities, and enable them to make well informed business decisions.

About the Role

AmCham Singapore seeks a poised, energetic, creative and confident executive to be part of the Strategic Partnerships and Development team. This full-time position will report to the Senior Director, Strategic Partnerships & Development and will work closely with the team to drive drive member recruitment and retention efforts. The position allows for significant exposure to business leaders across a wide range of industries and sectors and therefore requires high emotional intelligence, strong powers of persuasion, clear communication skills, and a personable and professional presence. This is a people-oriented role that requires a professional who is a detail-oriented self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

This is a sales-oriented role that requires a professional who is a self-starter, meticulous in account management and thrives in a fast-paced collaborative environment. As a core member of the Strategic Partnerships & Development team, she/he will contribute to meeting monthly, quarterly and annual new member recruitment and/or member retention targets.

The Executive will coordinate the day-to-day member engagement activities for both current and prospective member companies, including timely follow-up of enquiries and account administration support. AmCham’s Strategic Partnerships & Development team are frontline representatives of AmCham and are expected to cultivate and maintain an extensive knowledge of all Chamber members, programs, services, and initiatives so that they can share relevant information when necessary. Most importantly, the candidate will be seen by member companies as the go-to person for information on member services.

Major Responsibilities
Engage with existing member companies (e.g., emails, voice and video calls, in-person meetings, etc.) to ensure members continue to effectively leverage on the benefits of AmCham membership
Respond to queries from new member leads and existing member companies in a timely manner
Achieve or exceed monthly new member recruitment and/or retention targets as established by supervisor and achieve budgeted revenue goals
Develop standardized reports using the Chamber’s CRM system to provide detailed information on the life cycle of members and their engagement activities with AmCham
Proactively update the CRM system on a regular basis and ensure member account information is accurate
Collaborate with AmCham senior management and colleagues to achieve organizational goals
As an AmCham employee, represent the organization’s brand and values to the external stakeholders and leaders from the AmCham business community
As required, provide logistical support for the Chamber's events
Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned

Job Description:
Coordinating, arranging and timely follow up Oil Major Vetting Inspections as directed.
Attend vessels to conduct Marine Inspections and pre-vetting inspections or vetting assistance as directed. Ensure follow-up of all deficiencies noted during vessel attendance is recorded and filed in the common drive.

Assist in periodical management review of ASL HSSEQ system, record findings from the reviews and propose actions if necessary.
Assist in the investigation and root cause analysis of accidents, marine casualties and near misses.
Assist in preparation, implementation and maintenance of office and vessel’s contingency plans.
Liaise with the vessels in safety, navigation, operations, health, quality, security and environmental matters, including monthly response to vessels relating to Vessel Monthly Safety Reports and Near Miss Reports.
Strong knowledge of maritime regulations.
Prefarable experience in Ship Vetting by majors, Ship and Terminal Operations.

Job Description:
ARTC aspire to help our customers and partners achieve translational research to technology deployment in FMCG & e-Commerce industry by leveraging the power of research and development to co-innovate and co- develop.
Responsibilities
As a Business Development Officer, reporting to the Senior Business Development Manager, you will play a pivotal role responsible for members? success through the management of program deliveries and strong customer relationships. You will have the opportunity to implement the FMCG & e-Commerce business strategy, driving collaborations between industry partners and ARTC, securing projects and building a collaborative ecosystem.
This role focuses on managing and growing ARTC"s FMCG & e-Commerce Pillar members with professionalism and for impactful collaboration outcome.
Our prevailing business priority is the members? successful adoption and productive use of our technologies and solutions. You are front and centre with our members supporting their manufacturing transformation journey.
Key Accountabilities include
Drive value-based engagements with key members and external stakeholders.
Build a robust and sustainable FMCG & e-Commerce ecosystem comprised of product owners, solution & technology providers, manufacturers, system integrators, institute of higher learning, research institutes, and public agencies.
Strategize, develop, and execute business plans for multistakeholders and senior executives? engagements with key members.
Develop deep relationships with key members, identify business opportunities for growth, negotiate and close business deals.
Lead conversations with members to capture business and technical requirements, identify problem statements to scope work package proposals for collaboration.
Work closely with our technical divisions and project management office to enable the translation of research outcomes to business viable products and or solutions.
Coordinate with other A*STAR Research Institutes and public agencies to deliver business viable solutions.
Job requirements
Bachelor in any business/engineering-related discipline.
Preferably candidate with at least 3 years of working experience in business-related functions, technology, enterprise sales/account management and marketing.
Proven track record in sales and sales achievement, with experience in value-based selling, selling as a team, and selling services is advantageous.
Strong business acumen, and is self-driven to deliver members? requirements and project deadlines.
Professional presentation and communication skills for management-level audience, both written and verbal.
Positive attitude, resilient, agile, attention to detail and able to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
Hexadius is looking for Business Analysts with minimum 5 (five) years of relevant work experience. Relevant experience may come from working with a consultancy or end user organization.

The Identity & Access Management (‘IAM’) Business Analyst will be responsible for gathering business requirements, analysing them and designing a functional design of the proposed IAM solution for various IAM projects delivered by Hexadius to its clients.
Some of the day-to-day duties include:
Gather and documenting functional/ business requirements for IAM implementation covering various IAM functionalities such as user lifecycle management, access request, policy management, password management, PAM integration, Single Sign On/ Multi Factor Authentication, Role Based Access Control, etc
Analysing business requirements and defining a functional design for IAM solution
Documenting to-be process flows for the above IAM functionalities
Develop IAM implementation roadmap
Assist clients with various options for IAM functionalities and explaining pros/ cons for various options and communicate various aspects of best practice IAM process designs and methodologies
Identify IAM project KPIs
Review IAM technical design documents for compliance and alignment with functional. business requirements
Prepare user manuals for implemented IAM solution
Develop training plan
Prepare training slides and conduct end user trainings for implemented IAM solution
Develop test plan
Document test scripts based on the agreed business requirements
This role will be client facing and will require continuous touchpoints with client personnel. The ideal candidate can expect to learn at a fast pace within a supportive and well mentored environment, working with a driven and ambitious team, with possible career growth opportunities over time.

The following attributes, while not mandatory, will be highly regarded:
Organized, with attention to detail
Excellent analytical, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication/ presentation skills
Excellent and structured documentation skills (use case, data modelling, process design, workflow descriptions)
Strong and proven skills in requirements analysis (business/ functional)
Proficient with, or able to quickly become proficient with, a range of general and specialized cybersecurity solutions
Proficient with Microsoft Office suite
Conceptual knowledge of leading IAM solutions (e.g., SailPoint, Saviynt, Okta, PingIdentity)

Provide insights into how supply-demand dynamics influence crude oil pricing and trading strategies.
Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly market reports for the trading team.
Maintain and update databases of market data, trade information, and historical price data.
Develop and maintain analytical models and tools to support trading decisions.

Degree in Business Analyst, International Trading, Economic or any related field
At least 2 years’ experience in trading, market analysis, or a related role within the oil and gas industry
Strong understanding of global crude oil markets, including pricing methodology, premiums, supply, and demand dynamics etc…
Proficiency in trading platforms and data analysis tools
Proficiency in speaking and writing Mandarin is essential for effective communication with China counterparts and head office

Job Description:
Our client is a fast-growing Medical Device company renowned for its commitment to providing high-quality products to the patients. As they continue to expand their market presence, they are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales Representative to join their team.

Role Overview:
Looking for an ambitious and self-motivated Sales Representative for our client in the medical device industry. The ideal candidate will be a proactive self-starter with a strong ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. This individual will play a key role in driving sales growth by identifying new business opportunities, cultivating relationships with existing clients, and achieving sales targets.
Key Responsibilities:
Sales Growth: Proactively identify and pursue new sales opportunities within the nutraceutical market, including retailers, healthcare providers, and direct consumers.
Client Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients, providing excellent service and support to ensure client satisfaction and repeat business.
Product Expertise: Gain and maintain a deep understanding of the client’s nutraceutical products, effectively communicating their benefits to prospective customers.
Sales Strategy Implementation: Develop and execute sales strategies to meet and exceed sales goals, utilizing market research and competitive analysis.
Multitasking: Manage multiple sales pipelines simultaneously, ensuring timely follow-up, effective communication, and successful deal closures.
Independent Operation: Operate with a high level of autonomy, demonstrating initiative and resourcefulness in achieving sales objectives.
Collaboration: Work closely with the client’s marketing, product development, and customer service teams to ensure alignment and support in achieving sales targets.
Reporting: Maintain detailed records of sales activities, customer interactions, and market intelligence, and provide regular updates to the client’s sales management team.
Candidate Requirements:
Proven experience in sales, preferably within the medical device, pharmaceutical, or health and wellness sectors.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish and maintain client relationships.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and priorities.
A self-starter with a demonstrated ability to work independently and achieve sales goals.
Knowledge of the nutraceutical industry and a passion for health and wellness are highly desirable.
Proficiency in CRM software and other sales tools.
Willingness to travel as required for client and customer meetings.
Benefits:
Competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives.
Comprehensive benefits provided by the client, including health insurance and retirement plans.
Opportunities for professional growth within a rapidly expanding company.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
To find out more about this opportunity, please contact Steffan Lian at Steffan.Lian@gmprecruit.com

Job Description:
At Jacobs, we’re helping our clients innovate and grow by designing, engineering, and executing the construction of their various facilities that are changing our world. Our talented experts create exceptional spaces across the world through our creative blending of human need, environmental stewardship, value creation, science and art. We believe that built environments should reflect the context, history, cultures, communities, and the natural environment while incorporating advances in technology.
Jacobs would like to welcome a Project Engineer to join our Water business in Singapore. You will have unlimited opportunities to work with high-performing teams on multiple water projects across Singapore. Main responsibilities:
Working together with Project Manager(s) on multiple water projects, mainly water conveyance infrastructure projects, large transmission pipelines, and coastal adaptation studies.
Proactively lead the permitting/consultation process various statutory authorities and utility agencies.
Liaise with clients and act as the contact point alongside the Project Manager.
Co-chair the Client meetings with Project Manager and prepare meeting minutes.
Carry out hydraulic calculations (stormwater modeling and pressure pipes).
Occasionally carry out site supervision for site investigation works, pipe laying works as required.
Involvement in the preparation of tender specifications and other deliverables.
To be a successful candidate you shall possess :
Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, from a university recognized by BCA or Singapore PEB.
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in civil infrastructure works in Singapore. Experience in coastal engineering work will be an added advantage.
Ability to read engineering drawings; and carry out hydraulic calculations. Stormwater modelling and pressure pipes will be an added advantage
Proficiency in MS Office including MS Project, possess basic navigational skills to use CAD software (Microstation, AutoCAD).
Self-driven and able to work in a team.
Excellent communication and writing skills in English.
**The remuneration package will be commensurate with the depth of knowledge and experience of the individual**
Jacobs. A world where you can.
From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed.
With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company.
Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs. Jacobs complies with the Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices (TGFEP), including the prevailing guidelines on recruitment. All qualified applicants will be considered for the position regardless of age, race, religion, language, nationality, marital status, or family responsibilities.

Assists in interpreting and applying processes and procedures to conduct/monitor project progress

Planning and operation of the international meetings, conferences, seminars, and webinars
Project related task reports as requested.

Master’s degree in materials and mechanical engineering
Experience in thesis and/or paper writing and publish
Experience in research project collaboration with research institutes
Experience in work software, including MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Experience with lab management is preferred but not mandatory
Excellent on/offline communication and organizational skills
Able to work within teams
Self-motivated, fast learner, and confident in presenting to and engaging with external stakeholders

Job Title: Head, Junior Music, School of Young Talents
Job Description:
Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA), University of the Arts Singapore, an esteemed arts institution with a global reputation seeks an innovative and dynamic leader to join our team as Head of Junior Music to propel the academy towards even greater recognition.
In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for shaping and driving the Junior Music’s academic and administrative functions to ensure the highest standard of music courses for children aged 4 to 18 years. You should have an understanding of the arts/education sector and a passion for advancing the mission of arts education.

Key Responsibilities
Curriculum Delivery : Monitor and keep up-to-date on the curriculum of existing courses and develop new courses and/or programmes, including teaching practice, learning strategy and pedagogical innovation, to ensure high-quality delivery and also to meet students' needs

Planning and Organistion of Activities: Plan and organize various activities such as masterclasses, competitions, performances, exchange programmes or any internal/external events to enrich students' learning as well as raise the profile and standard of School of Young Talents

Financials, Resource Planning and Budgeting: Plan and manage financial resources according to approved budgets. Responsible for staff planning and development, including coaching and mentoring staff

Teaching Hours: Undertake 10-14 contact hours per week during weekends every semester.
Requirements
Minimum degree preferably Masters with at least 10 years of teaching and relevant management experience, preferably in Music
Strong leadership and people-management skills with the ability to foster cohesion and teamwork
Achievements and Recognition in the music circle.
Proficient in Microsoft Office
If you are a visionary leader with a strong track record in music education, with a passion for the arts and an enterprising spirit, we encourage you to apply. This is your opportunity to lead as the new Head for Junior Music, School of Young Talents at NAFA to a new era of global recognition and shape the future of children’s music education in Singapore and beyond.

Job Description:
Listed amongst Singapore's award-winning digital agencies, Digipixel is dedicated to providing web solutions, brand consultancy, and marketing that seamlessly integrate creativity, security, and targeted traffic.

As a Cyber Trust Certified agency by the Cyber Security Agency of Singapore, we offer innovative and secure digital solutions to our clients.

Our mission is to help brands thrive with confidence by staying secure, innovative, and relevant in today’s digital world. We are now seeking a Creative Strategist to take on a leadership role, overseeing the creative direction of our projects and driving brand and web design strategies for our diverse portfolio of clients.

Job Summary:

As a Creative Strategist , you will lead the creative vision for Digipixel’s branding, marketing, and web design projects. You’ll be responsible for conceptualising, developing, and executing innovative design solutions that align with clients’ brand objectives. You will work closely with the design and development teams, ensuring that creative outputs are on-brand, effective, and meet client expectations.

Job Description:
Lead the creative direction for all branding, web design, and marketing projects, ensuring cohesive and impactful visual storytelling.
Develop and execute comprehensive creative strategies that align with client goals and brand positioning.
Oversee the entire design process from concept to execution, guiding the team to deliver exceptional design solutions that meet project objectives and timelines.
Collaborate with clients to understand their brand vision, goals, and target audience, translating these insights into effective design concepts and strategies.
Manage, mentor, and inspire a team of designers, providing constructive feedback and guidance to elevate their work.
Work closely with web developers to ensure design elements are translated effectively into functional and user-friendly websites.
Present creative concepts, strategies, and campaigns to clients, articulating the rationale behind design decisions and ensuring alignment with their brand identity.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in branding, web design, and digital marketing to ensure Digipixel remains at the forefront of creative innovation.
Conduct competitor analysis and industry research to identify opportunities for creative differentiation.
Develop and maintain Digipixel's internal brand guidelines, ensuring consistency across all creative outputs.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 5+ years of experience in a creative leadership role, preferably with experience in brand strategy and web design.
Strong portfolio showcasing a range of branding, web design, and creative campaign projects.
Proficient in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Figma, or other design tools.
Exceptional understanding of branding principles, visual storytelling, and web design concepts, with a strong grasp of user experience (UX) best practices.
Proven experience leading creative teams, managing multiple projects, and delivering high-quality design solutions.
Excellent communication, presentation, and leadership skills, with the ability to articulate creative concepts and strategies to both clients and internal teams.
Strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail and a passion for delivering innovative design solutions.
Job Benefits:
Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.
Leadership role with opportunities for professional growth and development.
Access to training and development resources.
Work on high-profile projects for diverse clients and industries.

Are you a sales designer looking for salary based role or a refreshing change of scene?

Enjoy the creative aspects of designing spaces but not the project management aspects?

We have just the opportunity for you.

Job Title: Research Engineer – Semiconductor Equipment including Test, IME
Job Description:
Responsibilities
Coordinate with all tool-install base contractors to execute equipment hookup for new tools, to meet the high-quality standards, dynamic schedule, and forecasted budget.
Coordinate with the Project owner (NGTC/APM/SIC/FAB) to facilitate utility release as per the planned schedule and update tool release status timely
The candidate will be required to perform electrical testing, test data analysis & automation across SiC power and RF/mmWave GaN devices.
It will be a plus if the candidate has knowledge of instrumentation control using LabView and some other software like Python, C++ etc .
Follow all safety and environmental procedures to ensure compliance with EHS-related regulations, risk assessment, safe work procedures, and permit-to-work system.
Play an active role in safety, actively participating in safety discussions and safe work practices.
Establish regular area walks to identify opportunities for improved safety, cleanliness, housekeeping and, efficiency
Establish regular, working interaction with peers as well as vendors in tool installation & facilitation, communicating clearly and respectfully all relevant information.
The candidate is required to have at least some basic semi- conductor knowledges of semi-conductor devices like P-N Junction, Diodes, CMOS etc.
The candidate can be exposed to process and device design/simulation with commercial TCAD tools (e.g. Silvaco Victory Process and Victory Device, Sentaurus Process and Device, etc) as part of the learning development and eventually be working on wide bandgap devices team.
Keep the reporting officer informed regarding the progress of assigned work and any abnormalities observed in your area.
Demonstrate ability to understand drawing and highlighting discrepancies
Follow area-specific procedures and documentation
Prioritize work tasks to meet schedule and expectations, minimum guidance
Perform tool tool-relativities and cleanroom systems troubleshooting during the hookup phase
To perform equipment trouble-shooting of the equipments in FAB when the need arises
To perform utility-on after installation completion and to work closely with LCAM for complete closure
To perform tests balancing of exhaust for new tools whenever necessary
To perform measures for tool consumption during the hookup phase and to work closely with LCAM
Use methods to organize, calculate, and display data accurately for utility and flowrate measurement
Perform site activities in accordance to the Discipline
Qualifications:
Bachelors / Masters' degree in Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or equivalent.
Strong communication, industry awareness, and problem-solving skills.
Highly motivated to succeed, a self-starter who is driven and able to work with others effectively to "get things done".
Industry experience is a plus.

Job Description:
Crude Oil Trade Analyst | Permanent
Oil & Gas industry
CBD | salary up to $8000

Responsibilities:
To track global crude oil markets, including price movements, premiums, spreads, and key market indicators to identify trading opportunities.
To assess factors affecting crude oil prices and premiums such as production levels, geopolitical risks, market speculation, and transportation logistics.
To analyze and project global and regional crude oil demand based on economic growth, transportation trends, industrial usage, and government policies.
To evaluate supply aspects including production capacity, strategic reserves, and OPEC decisions etc.
To provide insights into how supply-demand interactions influence crude oil pricing and trading strategies.
To compile daily, weekly, and monthly market reports, maintain and update databases, and develop analytical models and tools to aid trading decisions.

Requirements:
Possess Degree in Business Analyst, International Trading, Economics, or a related field
Minimum 2 years’ experience in trading, market analysis, or a related role within the oil and gas industry
Proficiency in trading platforms, data analysis tools, MS office, Word, and Excel
Effectively bilingual in Chinese & English due to reporting to China Head Office & colleagues

Job Title: Manager / Senior Manager (Scientific and Business Management), IMCB
Job Description:
The role of the Manager / Senior Manager, Resource Personnel (RP) is to support the Research Entity (RE) / Principal Investigators (PIs) in managing the processes related to the management of core and non-core funding including budgeting, proper cost allocation and charging, making quarterly projections, making grant requisitions, liaising with the auditors of the grants, and submitting the requisite reports as required within the terms and conditions of the grants and reporting on the utilisation. In addition, the RP will support general RE administration and may be required to supervise staff.

Job Description
Be a strategic partner, working closely with BD/PMO and Grants teams, and support the key stakeholders on management of budgets and grants to ensure progress and sustainability of the institute.
Manage fund requisitions, audits, and reconciliations of expenses.
Provide timely reporting, projections and tracking of budget and expenses.
Conduct quarterly budget reviews, statistical analyses of data, trends as well as analyse budget utilization.
Ensure internal controls and financial procedures are in compliance with A*STAR Financial Policy and Procedures (FPP).
Prepare annual and ad-hoc budget projections.
Train and equip Lab Admins with finance management knowledge and skills.
Contribute to various new finance / budget / resource initiatives at the RE or at A*STAR, as needed.
Supervise staff, if needed.
Job Requirements
Educational background in Business Administration / Finance with at least 3 to 5 years of experience in resource or grant management, financial planning and analysis, as well as financial operations and reporting.
Well versed in SAP GUI, Microsoft Office particularly Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Strong strategic and analytical thinking skills.
Resourceful and self-driven.
Effective communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.
Able to multi-task and deliver results under tight timelines.
Able to work independently and in a team to deliver results under tight timelines.
Willing to take on ad-hoc additional duties.
